News_Shorts: April 9, 2017 saw presidential elections and the referendum on resumption of the historic name “the State of Alania” that took place in the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of the Head of the Official Representation of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic

Under the Decree of the Minister of Foreign Affairs dated April 10, 2017 Vitaliy V. Yankovskiy was appointed as Head of the Official Representation of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Statements of Anna Fotyga, the Chair of the Subcommittee on Security and Defense (SEDE) of the European Parliament, representatives of the U.S. State Department and other institutions where they express “deep concern” over the presidential elections in the Republic of South Ossetia appointed for April 9 and the referendum on resumption of the historic name “the State of Alania”, which will be used alongside with current name of the Republic, diffused by the MFA of Georgia were not left without attention in South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, on April 5.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On April 4 officers of the MFA of the Republic of South Ossetia laid flowers to the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic in commemoration of victims of the terrorist attack in St. Petersburg on April 3.
Citizens of South Ossetia were making floral tribute at the Embassy of the Russian Federation expressing condolences to people of the Russian Federation.
Vitaliy Khasiev, born in South Ossetia, was injured by the attack and for the time being is in hospital in St. Petersburg. 
April 5, 2017, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, met with Carlos Rafael Faría Tortosa, the newly appointed Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in the Republic of South Ossetia.
The parties exchanged opinion about the perspectives of bilateral cooperation and development of friendly ties between South Ossetia and Venezuela. 
April 3, 2017, Tskhinval

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts: Pertaining to the results of the 39th round of the Geneva International Discussion

News_Titles: Comment by representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: March 24 saw the 34th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council adopting the Resolution on Cooperation with Georgia where the absolutely baseless alarm about “human rights and humanitarian situation in South Ossetia” and the impossibility of access of international observers to South Ossetia territory was stated. The document was formulated and submitted at the session by Georgia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
In anticipation of presidential elections and the referendum on resumption of the historic name “the State of Alania” to South Ossetia scheduled for April 9, 2017 a meeting of officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs was organized on March 21, 2017.
The participants discussed the internal political situation in the Republic and once again emphasized the necessity to maintain it within a legal framework.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: March 20 saw the parliamentary delegation of the Nordic-Baltic Eight (NB8) accompanied by the State Minister of Georgia for Reconciliation and Civic Equality visiting Khurvaleti, a Georgian settlement located at the border with the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A telephone conversation between Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, and Vitaly Ignatiev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic, took place on March 17.
Issues related to the development of the bilateral relation between the two Republics as well as other questions of mutual interest were discussed during the conversation. 
Tskhinval, March 17, 2017

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The Agreement between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation about the procedures for certain divisions of the RSO Armed Forces entry to the structure of Russian Armed Forces that is currently under preparation for signing caused strong feelings among Georgian political and public community as it allegedly violates “the sovereignty and the territorial integrity of Georgia” and “destabilizes the situation in the region”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: March 14 saw a meeting of Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, and members of South Ossetian delegation at the GID, with Alexey Dvinyanin and Marat Kulakhmetov, representatives of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation and members of Russian delegation at the Discussions.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with representatives of the ICRC Representation in the Republic of South Ossetia.
Nalan Antmen, Head of the Representation, whose mission on the ground is terminating, expressed gratitude to the authorities of the Republic for the working conditions in South Ossetia and introduced her successor, Farrukh Islomov, the new Head of the Representation.

News_Titles: Message about the bilateral meeting between representatives of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Ministry of Popular Power for Foreign Affairs of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela
News_Shorts: Within the visit to the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela bilateral consultations between delegations of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Ministry of Popular Power for Foreign Affairs of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela took place in Caracas on March7-8.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Working visit of the delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia consisting of Alan Kochiev, the Deputy Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, and Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, is going on.
The delegates participated in commemoration events dedicated to the 4th anniversary of Venezuelan leader Hugo Chavez’s death. Alongside with this members of the delegation met with Vladimir Zaemskiy, Ambassador of the Russian Federation to Venezuela. Meetings with delegations of several states that also took part in ceremonies were organized as well.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetia delegation at the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia, hosted a meeting with the Co-Chairs of the Discussions representing the EU, the OSCE and the UN, who arrived to the Republic on March 07 in anticipation of the 39th round of the Discussions.
Full agenda of coming round scheduled for late March, including issues that correspond to the GID, were discussed during the meeting.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Commemoration events dedicated to the 4th anniversary of Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez’s death are taking place in Caracas on March 5-7, 2017.
A delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia consisting of Alan Kochiev, the Deputy Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, and Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, arrived in Caracas upon invitation from the authorities of Venezuela. 
The delegates participated in the solemn ceremony that was organized in the Museum of the Revolution, where is the mausoleum to Comandante Chavez, on March 5.

News_Titles: Comment by representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: South Ossetia paid attention to the tendentious and prejudiced resolution adopted by the U.S. Congress in support of the “territorial integrity” of Georgia. Once again, the bias position of the U.S. congressmen can be judged from the fact that they unreservedly support the position of Georgia and appeal to Russia to “call back recognition of independence of South Ossetia and Abkhazia”.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The statement made by Zurab Abashidze, the Georgian Prime Minister’s Special Representative for Relations with Russia, in interview to Starvision TV, in which he expresses his opinion that sooner or later Russia would call back recognition of the independence of South Ossetia, was perceived with certain irony in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, visited Embassy of the Russian Federation to the Republic of South Ossetia and delivered condolences to Elbrus Kargiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Russian Federation in RSO, on the passing of Vitaly Churkin, Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the UN, on February 21, 2017.
Tskhinval, February 21, 2017

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: February 13, 2017 saw a meeting of Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, with Nalan Antmen, Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia, whose mission on the ground is terminating.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia to South Ossetia International Information Agency
News_Shorts: Q: A meeting of Grigoriy Karasin, State Secretary, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, and Zurab Abashidze, Georgian Prime Minister's Special Representative for Relations with Russia, was held on February 7. Despite the fact that it was a regular meeting in this format, information about its outcome attracted public attention in South Ossetia. What are the reasons of that?

News_Titles: Comment of Murat Dzhioev, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, pertaining to Presidential Decree dated February 6, 2017 «On conducting a referendum in the Republic of South Ossetia»
News_Shorts: Decree issued by Leonid Tibilov, the President of the Republic of South Ossetia, on holding a referendum on resumption of the historic name of our state is a politically timely and historically justified decision.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A referendum, where citizens will be able to express their opinion on the rebirth of the ancient name of their country, the State of Alania, will be held in the Republic of South Ossetia on April 9, 2017.
A lot of people in the world, and first of all in friendly countries, hail this decision as a most important act that shows a commitment of South Ossetia to the principles of the democratic system of a state, fundamental right of its people in an confirming the sovereignty and the historical continuity of their state.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Telephone conversation between Murat Dzhioev and Vitaliy Ignatyev, Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Pridnestrovien Moldavian Republic, was organized on February 8, 2017.
In the course of conversation were discussed the issues of the further development and intensification of bilateral relations between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Pridnestrovien Moldavian Republic, the unity of opinions and approaches to international cooperation was noted.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The decision that was made by the European Parliament on February 2 about provision of visa-free regime to Georgia has caused a boundless euphoria among Georgian authority, which began to offer these benefits to “those citizens of Georgia who live in territories that are not controlled by Georgian central government – in Abkhazia and Tskhinvali region”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Egor Kochiev, Head of Diplomatic Mission of the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic in the Republic of South Ossetia, on February 2, 2017.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Couldn't but draw attention to the latest attempts to define “the status of Abkhazia and South Ossetia” once again undertaken in Georgia. This time the issue of their “special status as part of Georgia” was discussed by a constitutional commission of the neighboring state.
The absurd idea about a possibility of a certain “reintegration” and coexistence of South Ossetia, Abkhazia and Georgia within one state is imposed on Georgian society with a persistence that deserves better application.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia to South Ossetia International Information Agency
News_Shorts:
Q: Could you please comment on the situation around conditions of the arrival of Julietto Kieza, a famous Italian journalist and political figure, to the Republic of South Ossetia. 
A: That’s right. Upon invitation from one of the political parties of the Republic, Mr. Kieza arrived to Tskhinval on January 23, 2017. Unfortunately, he faced certain problems while crossing the state border of the Republic of South Ossetia, as the receiving party had ignored the legal requirements pertaining to the entry procedures for foreign citizens arriving to the Republic of South Ossetia. The problem was solved rather fast, however the hosting party didn’t miss out the opportunity and tried to overblow a political scandal and shuffle off the responsibility for consequences of an incident that became a result of disrespect for the legislation of your own country to the MFA.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
January 24, 2017 saw a meeting of Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, with Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation.
The Ambassador reported to the Minister about the results of the Embassy’s activity in 2016. Later a discussion of the perspectives promoting development and strengthening cooperation and integration with the Russian Federation took place. 
January 25, 2017, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua, on January 24, 2017.
Ambassador Kozaev reported to the Minister about the details of recent visit to the Republic of Nicaragua, where he participated in inauguration ceremony of Daniel Ortega, the President of Nicaragua.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the 25th Anniversary of the referendum on independence of the Republic of South Ossetia

The 25th Anniversary of the historic referendum on independence of the Republic of South Ossetia is celebrated on January 19, 2017. 25 years has passed since South Ossetia nation took that crucial political step on its way to building statehood. At a nation-wide vote, organized in full compliance with legal norms, in presence of many international observers, our people executed its inalienable right for the independence and the right for choice of free and safe development.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua, took part in inauguration ceremony of Daniel Ortega that took place in Revolution Square in Managua on January 10, 2017.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
December 30 saw a meeting of officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs where Murat Dzhioev, Head of the Ministry, summarized the achievements of 2016 and set tasks for the coming 2017 year.
According to the Minister, year 2016 was rather fruitful for the MFA, as in general, all tasks set by the President of the Republic of South Ossetia and the ruling legislation have been accomplished.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Under the Decree of Leonid Tibilov, the President of the Republic of South Ossetia, Moris Sanakoev, the Consular agent of the Republic of South Ossetia in Vladikavkaz, was conferred a diplomatic rank Envoy Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary on December 7, 2016.
December 19, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts: Pertaining to the results of the 38th round of the Geneva International Discussions

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
South Ossetia party, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, is participating in the 38th round of the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia that is taking place on December 13-14, 2016.
December 13 saw bilateral consultations between South Ossetia party and representatives of international organizations and trilateral consultations between delegations of the Republic of South Ossetia, the Republic of Abkhazia and the Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Comment of Alan Kochiev, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: A regular session of the OSCE Council of Ministers took place in Hamburg on December 8-9, 2016. The session saw a group of states-friends of Georgia circulating a statement containing appeals to Russia to call back recognition of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Abkhazia, appeals for “peaceful solution of the conflict” and reorganizing in Georgia “a full-scale OSCE mission”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Oleg Botsiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Abkhazia, on December 7, 2016.
The Ambassador reported to the Minister about the work conducted by the Embassy, aimed at development of the bilateral cooperation in accordance with the reached agreements.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: December 6 saw Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, hosting a meeting with Marat Kulakhmetov, Counselor of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
November 24, 2016 saw the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia publishing another quarterly report “on the Human Rights Situation in the Occupied Regions of Georgia”, covering this time the period from July to September of the current year.
The document differs slightly form previous “reports” and completely corresponds to Georgian logic of deliberately creating negative images of states neighboring to Georgia – the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Abkhazia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Mauro Murgia, representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in Italy, met with Alberto Drudi, the Chair of Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Pezarro-Urbino.
Possibilities of commercial and industrial cooperation with South Ossetia as well as other terms of mutual interest were discussed during a meeting.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetia delegation at the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia, hosted a meeting with the Co-Chairs of the Discussions representing the EU, the OSCE and the UN, who arrived to the Republic on November 22 in anticipation of the coming 38th round of the Discussions.
The agenda of the round scheduled for December 13-14, 2016 was discussed during the meeting.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to “Legendy armii” program (Zvezda TV) dated November 15, 2016 dedicated to Unus-Bek Evkurov, Head of Ingushetia 

We consider it necessary that serious attention should be drawn at another attempt of rewriting historical facts related to aggravation of Ossetian-Ingush conflict in autumn 1992 that were made on Russian channel “Zvezda” in program “Legends of army with Alexander Marshal”, dedicated to Mr. Evkurov, Head of the Republic of Ingushetia. Exceptionally insulting for the Ossetian wordings was used in the program. There were obvious history facts travesty and aspiration to shift responsibility for victims, destructions and shattered confidence between neighboring states on Ossetian party.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Pertaining to a statement made by Leonid Kalashnikov, Russian State Duma member

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Nalan Antmen, Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia, on November 17.
The activity conducted by the Mission on territory of the Republic in general and direct humanitarian aid to certain population categories in particular were discussed at the meeting. The parties exchanged opinions on productivity of joint efforts aimed at missing citizens’ search as well as on other terms of cooperation.

News_Titles: Answer of Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, to TASS IA question
News_Shorts:
What is the agenda of the coming round of the Geneva International Discussions scheduled for December 13-14?
The next week we’ll have a meeting with the Co-Chairs of the Discussions, that is regularly organized in anticipation of meetings in Geneva.
Recently I had a telephone conversation with Daur Kove, Abkhazian Foreign Minister, and we were discussing our joint strategy at the GID, especially the issue of non-use of force. We’ll do our best to push other participants to work harder on this document. Another issue that we discussed was the issue of human rights execution. The fact is that Georgian authorities do the utmost to deprive citizens of South Ossetia and Abkhazia of the opportunity to go abroad, to make obstacles to receive visas or participate in cultural events.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Current terms of Ossetian and Abkhazian foreign bilateral relations as well as the forthcoming round of the Geneva International Discussions were talked over during a telephone conversation that took place between Murat Dzhioev and Daur Kove, Foreign Ministers of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Abkhazia.
The Ministers agreed on maintaining regular dialogue and close cooperation in strengthening South Ossetia and Abkhazia images at international arena.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The published information about the meeting of official delegation of the Georgian Patriarchy with James Appathurai, NATO Secretary General's Special Representative for the Caucasus and Central Asia, where as Metropolitan Andrew of Gori and Ateni stated, “the difficult situation in Abkhazia and Samachablo” had been discussed, wasn’t left without attention in South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to NATO-Georgia Exercise 2016 

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia expresses concern about NATO-Georgia Exercise 2016 scheduled for November 10-20. As declared, the main objectives of the exercises are “increasing the intercompatibility of Georgian, Allied and Partner Forces as well as enhancing command and control capabilities”.

News_Titles: Answer of Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, to Res IA question
News_Shorts:
- South Ossetia recognized the independence of the Donetsk and Lugansk People’s Republics in June 2014. After Presidential Decrees on recognition of the Republics were signed, the MFA of the RSO received instructions from President Tibilov to establish diplomatic relations with them. What can you say about the positive results of the Ministry’s work in this direction?
- According to the Constitution of the Republic of South Ossetia, the foreign policy of the state is defined by the President. As for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, it is an executive government agency that implements the agreed foreign policy of the state.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: October 13, 2016 saw a meeting of the autumn plenary session of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) where in his speech about human rights execution over Europe Frank-Walter-Steinmeier, the OSCE Chairperson-in-Office and German Foreign Minister, expressed his opinion about South Ossetia and in terms of observing the situation of human rights called the state a “grey zone” and a “black hole”.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the results of the 37th round of the Geneva International Discussions

October 4-5, 2016 saw a regular round of the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia where official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and the OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
The 37th round of the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia is being run in Geneva on October 4-5, 2016. Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, is heading South Ossetia delegation.
Bilateral consultations between members of South Ossetia delegation and representatives of international organizations took place on October 4. Trilateral consultations between delegations of South Ossetia, Russia and Abkhazia will be held during the day.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: September 27, 2016 saw a meeting of South Ossetia delegation at the GID, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, with Alexey Dvinyanin, Deputy Director of the 4th CIS Department of Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Marat Kulakhmetov, Counselor of the Minister, who are representatives of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, and members of Russian delegation at the Discussions.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The Treaty on Friendship, Cooperation and Partnership was signed between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic on September 20, 2016 within the framework of the festivities dedicated to the 26th Anniversary of the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Message from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the elections to the State Duma of the Russian Federation of the 7th convocation

Citizens of the Russian Federation who are permanent or temporary residents of the Republic of South Ossetia took part in the elections to the State Duma of the Russian Federation of the 7th convocation held on September 18.
Election preparations were made by the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic of South Ossetia with active support from the Republic’s authorities.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Statements on Russia-South Ossetia relations made by Vladimir Zhirinovsky at a press-conference organized in the press center of TASS on September 14 were not left without attention in South Ossetia. In particular he declared that “the position of the LDPR is not to help anybody, any republics, anywhere … Let them develop themselves, not by means of Russia, or let them become a part of Russia or let them return to some other region”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
September 13-14 saw the Co-Chairs of the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia visiting the Republic of South Ossetia.
Issues related to the agenda of the coming 37th round of the GID, scheduled for October 3-4, 2016 were discussed on September 13, 2016 at a meeting with Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: September 8, 2016 saw members of the House of Representatives of the U.S. Congress adopting by an absolute majority the Resolution (H. Res. 660) which contained not only the mythical and abstract theses about “the territorial integrity” and “occupation of Georgian regions” by Russia but also an appeal to give Georgia “opportunities for defense”.

News_Titles: Comment of Murat Dzhioev, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia pertaining to the 7th Anniversary of recognition of South Ossetia’s Independence by the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela
News_Shorts: September 10, 2009 saw the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela recognizing the independence of the Republic of South Ossetia that became an important political event in political life of our young Republic. Venezuela is the third country that followed the example of Russia and Nicaragua and made such a responsible and significant for us decision despite the difficulties the country was facing at that time. People of South Ossetia will always be thankful to the Venezuelan party for that.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to Alan Kochiev’s, Deputy Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, working visit to Italy and San-Marino


Alan Kochiev, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, returned from Italy where he had been on a working visit.
Range of issues related to cooperation development were discussed at different meetings with representatives of several political parties and public organizations in Marche and Veneto regions. 
Situation around the Republic of South Ossetia as well as possibilities of developing bilateral relations with Italy in various spheres were specifically mentioned at the press-conference of Alan Kochiev organized in Pizarro.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Egor Kochiev, Head of Diplomatic Mission of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic in the Republic of South Ossetia, on September 5.
Current terms of bilateral relations between the two Republics as well as range of issues of mutual interest were on the agenda. 
September 05, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, and officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs participated in the event dedicated to the International Day of the Disappeared, organized by the ICRC mission in the Republic of South Ossetia on August 30 in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Mauro Murgia, Representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in Italy, who arrived to Tskhinval on a working visit, on August 29.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Festivities dedicated to the 8th Anniversary of recognition of South Ossetia’s Independence by the Russian Federation were celebrated on August 26 in Tskhinval. Eight years have passed since Dmitry Medvedev signed the historic Decree of the Russian Federation President on Recognition of the Republic of South Ossetia, that had been preceded by years of bloody struggle of South Ossetia people against Georgia for the right for free life and future worth living.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela and in the Republic of Nicaragua, on August 24.
The Ambassador informed the Minister about details of recent visit to the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, where he participated in solemn ceremony and delivered credentials to President Maduro.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Nalan Antmen, Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia, on August 19.
Full range of the activity conducted by the Mission on territory of the Republic in general and latest achievements of the Committee as well as current projects and plans for the nearest future in particular were talked in detail.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Narim Kozaev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, handed over credentials to Nicolas Moros Maduro, the President of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, at the official ceremony that took place at the Miraflores presidential palace on August 10, 2016.
Greeting the Ambassadors on behalf of the Venezuelan people, President Maduro emphasized the importance of building up interstate relations based on mutual assistance and respect to international law.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to participation in the Third International Forum of Young Diplomats 


The Third Young Diplomats Forum, organized by the Board of Young Diplomats under the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation with the assistance of The Alexander Gorchakov Public Diplomacy Fund, was held in Moscow on August 2-3, 2016.
Young diplomats from the Republic of South Ossetia, the Republic of Abkhazia, the Republic of Armenia, the Republic of Belarus, the Republic of Kazakhstan, the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, the Republic of Moldova, the Russian Federation, the Republic of Tajikistan and Turkmenistan participated in the Forum.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of a Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia

Under the President Decree Murat Dzioev was appointed as a Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on August 9, 2016.
August 9, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: President Tibilov hosted a meeting with delegation of the Embassy of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela headed by Alvaro Enrique Sanchez Cordero, temporary charge d'affaires, which arrived to the Republic of South Ossetia upon the invitation received from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
July 12 saw Leonid Tibilov, the President of the Republic of South Ossetia, receiving credentials from Juan Ernesto Vásquez Araya, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Nicaragua in the Republic of South Ossetia.
Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, participated in delivery presentation of the credentials.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with delegation of the Embassy of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela headed by Alvaro Enrique Sanchez Cordero, temporary charge d'affaires.
Current bilateral agenda was discussed and exchange of opinions on the perspectives of intensifying cooperation and building up interaction between the Republic of South Ossetia and Venezuela took place in a confident and constructive atmosphere.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Juan Ernesto Vásquez Araya, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Nicaragua in the Republic of South Ossetia, who handed copies of credentials, on July 11.
Range of relevant issues concerning bilateral relations and the perspectives of cooperation between South Ossetia and Nicaragua at international stage were discussed at the meeting in warm and friendly atmosphere.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The resolution “Conflict in Georgia”, prepared by Georgia delegation, has been approved at the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly that took place on July 5 in Tbilisi.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Nalan Antmen, Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia, on July 01.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of an Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela 

Under the President Decree Narim Kozaev was appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela on June 27, 2016.
June 29, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Joint statement of South Ossetian and Abkhazian delegations on the Geneva International Discussions
News_Shorts: The UN General Assembly has been accepting draft resolution on refugees and displaced persons from South Ossetia and Abkhazia prepared by Georgian party for several years already. Delivering again and again the same writing of the document Georgia tries to impose on international community a unilateral politicized corrupt vision of the problem of refugees to support their non-legitimate territorial claims.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the results of the 36thround of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on June 14-15, 2016. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and the OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
We’ve paid attention to statements made by the US State Department’s Spokesperson about the referendum on joining the Russian Federation that is going to be held in the Republic of South Ossetia.
Not only words about support of Georgian territorial integrity that lost their relevance 24 years ago, but also absolutely inconsistent objections against such referendum being hold in South Ossetia were heard once again.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
South Ossetia delegates at the Geneva International Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia met the Co-Chairs of the Discussions representing the EU, the OSCE and the UN, who arrived in Tskhinval on May 23 in anticipation of the coming 36th round of the Discussions scheduled for June 14-15.
Issues related to the agenda of the coming round in general and problems that would be subjects of discussion in Geneva in particular were discussed at the meeting.

News_Titles: Appeal by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia to the Member States of the United Nations, the Participating States of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe and the Member
News_Shorts: Every year since 2009 Georgia submits a draft resolution on refugees and displaced persons from Abkhazia and South Ossetia to the UN General Assembly. The text of the resolution that is being imposed on the international community is silent on the fact that the emergence of such refugees and displaced persons is directly linked to Georgia's wars against South Ossetia and Abkhazia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Noble Partner 2016, the second large-scale NATO military exercises hold in Georgia, opened on May 11, 2016. The declared purpose of the trainings was increasing the level of cooperation and interaction between Georgia and NATO for further participation of Georgian army in joint military campaigns.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia, and officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs took part in solemn commemoration of the 71st Anniversary of the Victory in the Great Patriotic War and laid wreaths to the Obelisk of Glory on May 8.
May 8, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Andrey Tskhovrebov, the Acting Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Mauro Murgia, Representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in Italy on May 4, 2016.
Issues concerning operation of the representative office opened in Rome on April 2, 2016, were discussed on the meeting. The importance of this event for further promotion of South Ossetia interests in Italy was emphasized.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of an Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua

Under the President Decree Narim Kozaev was appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua on May 3, 2016.
Short biodata:

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Alan Kochiev, the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, hosted a meeting with Semen Afiyan, the NKR MFA Secretary General, and Artur Tovmasyan, the Head of faction “Rodina” (Motherland) of the NKR National Assembly, on April 11, 2016.
In his greeting speech Alan Kochiev stated that people of South Ossetia follow the situation in the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, sympathize with fraternal people and wish speedy solution to the crisis. He also offered condolences to families of victims.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Telephone conversation between Kazbulat Tskhovrebov and Karen Mirzoyan, Ministers of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, was organized on April 6, 2016.
Minister Tskhovrebov expressed serious concern over the affairs in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict area. The Minister assured his colleague that South Ossetia people follow the development of situation and offered words of support to people of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic. The need to exercise commitment and moderation for preventing uncontrolled escalation of the conflict, that can destabilize the entire region, was emphasized.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to tens situation in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict area 

The Republic of South Ossetia expresses serious concern over the ceasefire regime violation and marked aggravation of the situation in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict area. Particular concern is caused by reports on heavy weapons and military aircraft used by the parties. Military operation launched by the national Army of Azerbaijan against the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic Defense Army resulted in numerous victims including civilians.

News_Titles: Message from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Leonid Tibilov, South Ossetia President, arrived to Moscow on a working visit on March 31.
Wide range of questions on bilateral cooperation, including first of all, the assistance given to the Republic of South Ossetia by the Russian Federation in social and economic spheres in framework of the investment program, were discussed at the meeting with Vladimir Putin, the President of the Russian Federation. 
President Tibilov noted the high level of South Ossetia-Russia relations and emphasized the priority of security issues vital for the Republic as well as the importance of further implementation of the Treaty on Alliance and Integration signed between South Ossetia and Russia in March 2015.

News_Titles: Comment of Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, to South Ossetia International Information Agency
News_Shorts: Terroristic attacks becoming usual around the world show that no one is protected against international terrorism. Terrorism has no borders and threatens the whole world. There is no secret that special agencies themselves can be involved in organizing terrorist acts. 22 terroristic acts were organized by Georgian special agencies on territory of the Republic of South Ossetia from 2005 till 2008. They resulted in 16 victims and 34 injured who received wounds of varying severity and even became invalids.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the results of the 35th round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on March 22-23, 2016. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Nalan Antmen, Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia, on March 23.
Full range of the activity conducted by the Mission on territory of the Republic was talked in detail. In particular humanitarian assistance stipulated by the ICRC mandate was marked.

News_Titles: Comment of Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, to South Ossetia International Information Agency
News_Shorts:
On terrorist attacks in Belgium 

Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, stated about absolute condemnation of terrorist attacks that hit Belgian capital and resulted in large number of victims and injured. “We offer our deepest condolences to the government and families of the victims. People of South Ossetia experienced firsthand terrorist acts and therefore call the international community to be united against this evil”.
March 22, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: South Ossetia Foreign Minister Kazbulat Tskhovrebov Interview to Res IA
News_Shorts:
- Four citizens of the Republic of South Ossetia returned to their homes after 11-year imprisonment in Georgia. What work has been done these 11 years and what attempts has been made to release our citizens? 
- Indeed, difficult 11 years have our citizens spent in Georgian prisons. All these years we in South Ossetia were claiming that those detentions and imprisonments had been unlawful and insisted on release. This issue was regularly raised by South Ossetia representatives within the Joint Control Committee (JCC) and at other levels. However due to the unconstructive position of Georgian party and non-availability to solute even those problems that are humanitarian, non-political, there were no serious progress on this front. Therefore I would like to express gratitude for the efforts made by our public representatives in general and by Lira Kozeva in particular. They were engaged in this case and sometimes have gained even better results than those achieved by officials of the Republic due to the non-governmental character of activity. In particular, they helped in organizing meetings between relatives of the detainees and officials and in transmitting applications to Georgian governmental agencies.

News_Titles: Message from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
According to early agreements on mutual release, Georgij Zasseev, Iosif Kochiev, Georgij Valiev and Boris Turashvili, who had been jailed for life by Georgian officials in 2005, were transferred to South Ossetia delegation on March 10.
The procedure took place at check-point located near River Ingur about Abkhazian-Georgian border. Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, Viacheslav Chirikba, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Abkhazia, Oleg Botsiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Republic of South Ossetia in Republic of Abkhazia, and other officials participated in the procedure.

News_Titles: Condolence Message from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the passing of Znaur Gassiev 


Zanur Gassiev, a conspicuous statesman of the Republic of South Ossetia, passed away March 6, 2016 in his 91st year.
A grand statesman, wise politician and patriot, he was sincere when dedicated all his life to the interests of his people. Each person in South Ossetia and abroad who knew him would remember Znaur Nikolaevich as a man of marked individuality with long life experience, who had always been friendly and openhearted.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
The second session of the Expert Council affiliated to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia took place on 3 March 2016. Experts from North Ossetia –Alania - Valerij Dzhidzhoev and Ruslan Bzarov - Professors, Doctors of History, and Petr Khoziev participated in the session.
Current agenda in general, and Presidential Initiatives to conduct a referendum on joining the Republic of South Ossetia with the Russian Federation and a referendum on renaming the Republic of South Ossetia, was discussed. Moreover the participants unanimously supported the idea expressed by the Ministry to establish a Terminological Committee on the Ossetian language and adopted a joint statement.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetian mission, hosted a meeting with the Co-Chairs of the Geneva International Discussions representing the EU, the OSCE and the UN, who arrived to Tskhinval on March 2 in anticipation of the coming 35th round of the Discussions.
Issues related to the agenda of the round scheduled for March 22-23 were discussed at the meeting.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Competitive exam to Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO) of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation was organized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on February 24-25.
The competitions took place in accordance with the Charter on “Competitive exams for quotas to Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO) granted by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia”.

News_Titles: Press-release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the recall of Daniel Tibilov, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela and the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua, from the occupied posts.  


Under the President Decrees dated 29 February 2016 Daniel I. Tibilov was released from the post of the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela and the post of the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua.
March 1, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Alan Kochiev, the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, and officers of the Ministry participated in solemn commemoration of the Day of the Defenders and laid flowers to the monument to Ossetian defenders at the Cathedral Square.
February 22, 2016, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, David Sanakoev, the State Councellor of the President, and Inal Tasoev, Presidential Human Rights Ombudsman on February 4, 2016.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The Pre-Trial Chamber of the International Criminal Court (ICC) approved the request submitted by the Court Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda to conduct an investigation of war crimes and crimes against humanity “committed in and around South Ossetia” that would cover period from July 1 to October 10, 2008 on January 27.

News_Titles: Comment of Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, to South Ossetia Today International Information Agency
News_Shorts: Pertaining to the possibility of applying a “bundle principal” while signing additional agreements to the Treaty on Alliance and Integration concluded between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Interview to German magazine ZUERST!
News_Shorts:
- Honorable Minister, the 7th Anniversary of the notorious August affairs in South Ossetia, when you were attacked by Georgian army, has been commemorated this year. How do you see these affairs from current perspective?
- August 2015 saw the 7th Anniversary of one of the most bloody and tragic dates in modern history of South Ossetia when in the early hours of August 8, 2008 hundreds of guiltless people were killed as a result of a treacherous attack by Georgia upon South Ossetia. These casualties are an irreparable loss for the small-numbered Ossetian nation. Memory of the atrocities and crimes committed by Georgian troops at Ossetian land will remain an open sore in heart of each Ossetian. The feat of the defendants of Tskhinval, Ossetian and Russian peace-keepers, soldiers and officers of the Russian army, who defended people of South Ossetia of killing, will always be an object of pride and worship.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The European Commission released a report on Georgia’s implementation of the action plan on visa liberalization (VLAP) on December 18, 2015.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Valeriy Kalyakin, the President of the International Union “Descendants of the Victory” on December, 21.
According to Mr. Kalyakin one of the focal points of the Union’s activity is “preservation of historical memory, especially about the feat and bravery of the Soviet people during the Great Patriotic War. The President of the Union noted that the Ossetians not just participated in battles but left one of the most notable marks in history of the War.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the results of the 34th round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on December, 8-9, 2015. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.
As usual, the discussions were held in two working groups: on security and humanitarian issues.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to Venezuela parliamentary elections results 

National Assembly elections were held in Venezuela on December, 6.
The elections passed in accordance with the acting legislation and constitutional norms. Nicolas Maduro, the President of Venezuela, recognized the results of the elections. According to early results the oppositional block won the majority of seats in the National Assembly.

News_Titles: Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Interview to South Ossetia newspaper
News_Shorts:
- Kazbulat Inalovich, what can you say about the diplomatic achievements made this year? 
- Looking back on the year, one can say that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has reached the full range of the objectives that were set. The primary goal for the Ministry is to pursue the foreign policy course determined by the President of the Republic.

News_Titles: South Ossetia Foreign Minister Kazbulat Tskhovrebov Interview to Res IA
News_Shorts:
- How was the year 2015 for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs? What in your opinion is the best remembered activity conducted by the Ministry the expiring year?
- We consider last year being rather successful for the Ministry, as in general we gained full range of the objectives that had been set by the President of the Republic. Work of the MFA is a specific activity and therefore, one can not measure its results and effectiveness in any units. Work of our department is an everyday painstaking work conducted by many people, aimed at strengthening mutually beneficial cooperation with partners of the Republic, defending South Ossetia national interests at international stage and improving the image of our state.

News_Titles: Comment of Alan Kochiev, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the territorial claims of Tbilisi

Recent statement of Paata Zakareishvili, who was reasoning about ways of implementation of Georgian statehood in foreign territories, is a good confirmation of the fact that they keep on fantasizing about their territorial claims in Tbilisi.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation, delivered credentials to Vladimir Putin, the President of the Russian Federation, on November 26, 2015.
The official ceremony took place in the Alexander Hall in the Grand Kremlin Palace. 
November 26, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, met with Andrey Starkov, Head of Abkhazia and South Ossetia division of the Fourth CIS Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, on November, 24.
Aleksej Sanakoev, Head of Department of International Cooperation, Elbrus Kargiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Russian Federation in RSO, and Vitalii Soshnin, Minister-Counsellor of Russian Embassy in Tskhinval, participated in the meeting.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The first diplomatic passport of the Republic of South Ossetia was handed over to Leonid Tibilov, South Ossetia President, during a meeting with Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, on November, 23.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
The first session of the Expert Council affiliated to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, organized under Minister Tskhovrebov’s Order dated August 1, 2015 took place on November 19, 2015.
Within the session “Current foreign policy of the Republic of South Ossetia” the participants spoke about the importance of foreign policy agenda for the Republics’ national interests. Members of the council were united in their certainty that free exchange of expert opinions on current issues of foreign policy is a necessity. Alongside with this the attendees welcomed the initiative of organizing the Expert Council affiliated to the Ministry as a forum where broad range of foreign policy topics and international agenda could be discussed and the mechanism of interaction between the MFA of the Republic and expert community would be developed.

News_Titles: Comment of South Ossetia Foreign Ministry Press Service
News_Shorts: The 2nd meeting of the EU-Georgia Association Council took place on November, 16. Once again members of the European Union “confirmed their solid support for territorial integrity of Georgia” and expressed concern of the Treaty on Alliance and Integration signed between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
November, 17 saw a meeting of Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetian mission, with the Co-Chairs of the Geneva International Discussions representing the EU, the OSCE and the UN who had arrived to Tskhinval in anticipation of the coming round of the discussions.
The agenda of the 34th round of the discussions, planned for December 8-9, 2015 was talked over.

News_Titles: Comment of Maria Dzhioeva, Press Representative of South Ossetia Foreign Ministry
News_Shorts:
The Catalan Parliament initiated process of separating the autonomous community from Spain when accepted a corresponding resolution on November, 9.
Despite the sharp reaction for the resolution expressed in Madrid and EU in general, we hope the parties would manage to exercise restraint and use peaceful political tools in order to solve contentious questions through passing an exam on commitment to democratic values that are widely advocated in Europe.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Alan Kochiev, the Acting Foreign Minister, and officers of South Ossetia Foreign Ministry laid flowers at the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic of South Ossetia commemorating the passengers and the crew who became victims of the air disaster when Russian airliner went down in flames in Egypt.
November, 1, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the statement of Vitaly Churkin, Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the United Nations

October, 20 saw a meeting of the UN Security Council where Vitaly Churkin, Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the United Nations, called for termination of the USA arbitrary, as the States abuse their rights of the international organization receiving country. In particular there was a talk about visa discrimination of South Ossetia and Abkhazia representatives whom the US authorities refused visas under far-fetched pretexts. Thereby South Ossetia and Abkhazia are deprived of the opportunity to provide unbiased information when the State Parties are considering draft resolutions on the refugees’ problems that are annually submitted by Georgia for consideration of the UN General Assembly.

News_Titles: Comment of Alan Kochiev, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the International Criminal Court Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda’s intention to investigate the affairs of the August, 2008

Fatou Bensouda, the International Criminal Court Prosecutor, submitted an official request to the ICCt to conduct an investigation of the August affairs, when Georgia unleashed a full-scaled military aggression against South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Concerning the results of the 33rd round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on October, 6-7, 2015. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
July 6, 2015 saw Mauro Murgia, the President of Italy - South Ossetia Friendship Society, organizing a news conference in Palermo, Sicily. Reliable and accurate information on history of formation of the Republic of South Ossetia and the current international status of the Republic was delivered to the Italian journalists.
After the news conference the attendees were given an opportunity to examine South Ossetia and perceive the life of this small Caucasian country and its people through a photo exhibition “South Ossetia: the Country and People” prepared by Leonardo Mattioli.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
At the invitation of Irina Guchmazova, headmaster of school “Albion” named after Kosta Khetagurov, Kazbulat Tskhovrebov visited the school and met with teachers and upper-formers. The Minister shared his opinion on current issues of global politics, including the situation in Middle East.
Albina Chekhoeva, Head of Information Analytics Directorate, participate in the meeting.

News_Titles: Comment of Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, to South Ossetia Today International Information Agency pertaining to President Putin’s speech to the 70th Session of UN General Assembly
News_Shorts:
International community is following events of the 70th Session of the UN General Assembly.
President Putin’s UN General Assembly speech was expected as he spoke on Russian vision on international situation, problems in Middle East and Ukraine. 
I carefully listened to the President. There is no secret that South Ossetia has always been politically oriented to the Russian Federation and thus Russian opinion on definite terms of international agenda influences international policy of the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with official delegation of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, who arrived to Tskhinval to participate in celebrations dedicated to the 25th Anniversary of the Republic of South Ossetia.
Artur Harutyunyan, Head of Emergency Response Center of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, who headed the delegation, and Karen Topchyan, delegate of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic National Assembly in the National Assembly of Armenia, delivered congratulations with South Ossetia national holiday on behalf of Karen Mirzoyan, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
An Hour of National Symbols of the Republic of South Ossetia in anticipation of the National Flag Day and the 25th Anniversary of the Republic was held in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Konstantin Kochiev, State Counsellor to the President of the Republic, attended the meeting and made a brief retrospective journey into the history of South Ossetia formation and its national symbols – the National Flag, Emblem and Anthem, adoption.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
South Ossetia National awards ceremony took place in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on September, 25.
Upon recommendation of the Foreign Minister, under the President Decree, Madina Valieva, Counsellor of International Cooperation Department of South Ossetia Foreign Ministry, and Akhsar Dzhioev, Counsellor of South Ossetia Embassy in the Russian Federation, were awarded with medals “In commemoration of the 25th Anniversary of the Republic of South Ossetia”. 
September 25, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross in the Republic of South Ossetia on September, 25.
Terms of further activity conducted by the committee on territory of the Republic were discussed.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the results of an official visit of South Ossetia delegation to the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic

Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Igor Kochiev, Foreign Policy and Inter Parliamentary Relations Committee Chairman, went on an official visit to Tiraspol and participated in ceremonies dedicated to the 25th Anniversary of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic on September 1-3, 2015.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetian mission, hosted a meeting with the Co-Chairmen of the Geneva International Discussions who arrived to Tskhinval on September, 08.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Official delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia headed by Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, returning from Tiraspol, where the delegates had participated in ceremonies dedicated to the 25th Anniversary of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic, was detained by representatives of national security of the Republic of Moldova in Chisinau International Airport on September, 3.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Leonid Tibilov, the President of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with the official delegation of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic, headed by Alexander Kisnichan, Deputy Head of Government and Government Chief of Staff, on September 2, 2015 in Tskhinval.
Andrej Tskhovrebov, First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, participated in the meeting.
On behalf of Evgeny Shevchuk, the President of Pridnestrovie, the Head of Transdniestrian delegation awarded President Tibilov with First Class Order of Merit, a National Award of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic, and presented memorable gifts.

News_Titles: Pertaining to Development of Additional Agreements to the Treaty on Alliance and Integration signed between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation
News_Shorts:
The Treaty on Alliance and Integration was signed by Presidents Tibilov and Putin on March 18, 2015.
According to Article 14 of the Treaty the entry into force took place on the date of exchange of ratifications on July 30, 2015.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Official award ceremony was organized by Transdnestrian delegation that had arrived on a working visit to Tskhinval. Politicians and social activists of the Republic of South Ossetia were given national awards of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Andrej Tskhovrebov, First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, hosted a meeting with official delegation of the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic headed by Alexander Kisnichan, Deputy Head of Government and Government Chief of Staff, on September 1, 2015 in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Concerning the results of the 32nd round of the Geneva International Discussions

3Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on June, 30 – July 1, 2015 in Geneva. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Leonid Tibilov, South Ossetia President, hosted a meeting with Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation, Oleg Botsiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Abkhazia, and Moris Sanakoev, South Ossetia Consular Agent in Vladikavkaz.
The President emphasized diplomatic corps of the Republic have to be at high level to strengthen the established friendly ties with the receiving countries.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, South Ossetia Foreign Minister, hosted a meeting with Viacheslav Chirikba, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Abkhazia, on August 17, 2015.
Andrej Tskhovrebov, First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Aleksej Sanakoev, Head of Department of International Cooperation, participated in the meeting on South Ossetian part. Oleg Arshba, Deputy Foreign Minister of the Republic of Abkhazia, Adgur Chegiya, Head of the Department of the Russian Federation, the CIS, South Ossetia, the Moldovan Transdniestrian Republic and the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, and Alan Elbakiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Abkhazia in the Republic of South Ossetia, were members of the Abkhazian delegation.
