News_Titles: Comment of Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia to mass media pertaining to establishment of an Expert Council affiliated to South Ossetian Foreign Ministry
News_Shorts:
Under the Foreign Minister Order an Expert Council affiliated with the Ministry was found. Scientists, political experts, analytical experts, social activists can participate in work of the Council. There will be permanent members (citizens of the Republic) and external experts (including citizens of other states), who would be invited depending on subject of a certain meeting.
The idea of creating such a council appeared due to the necessity of having a permanent forum for exchanging opinions. Economists, scientists, political experts would get opportunity to have their say on current issues of foreign policy. We believe expert opinions would be of great use in achieving foreign policy objectives.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: In pursuance of the Foreign Minister Decree, dated August 01, 2015, “About establishment of an Expert Council affiliated with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs” political experts, scientists, analytical experts, social activists are invited to participate in work of the Council and take part in discussion of current issues of foreign policy. Applications have to be mailed by September 10, 2015 at: [email protected] or made by telephone 8 (929) 804 45 85.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
August, 11 saw consultations on consular problems held between foreign-policy departments of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation.
Alina Dzhagaeva, Chief of Consular Agency of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, and Andrey Frolov, Deputy Head of Consular Department of Russian Foreign Ministry, headed South Ossetian and Russian delegations correspondingly.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, took part in the official opening ceremony of Abkhazian Embassy in the Republic.
Leonid Tibilov, South Ossetia President, welcomed the attendees and emphasized the importance of opening an Embassy in developing South Ossetia-Abkhazia relations. As the President added, it also testifies strengthening friendly ties and establishing closer cooperation between the states in different spheres.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Requiem events dedicated to the 7th anniversary of military aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia took place in the Republic on August, 7-8.
Officers of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs participated in ceremonies. 
Mouning ceremonies started from wreath-laying to the Memorial Cross put up at former barracks of Russian peacekeeping forces. Wreaths and flowers were laid to the monument to a Hero of Russia major Denis Vetchinov and to “The Museum of Burned Souls”, a monument about village Tbet. Later an action “We will remember everything” took place at Teatralnaya square. A solemn ceremony of mourning was organized at stairs in front of the Parliament – the same place where Mariinsky Orchestra conducted by Valery Gergiev had performed a Requiem Concert.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Under the President Decree Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation, was conferred a diplomatic rank “Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary” on July 30, 2015.
July 31, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the exchange of ratifications of the Treaty on Alliance and Integration signed between South Ossetia and the Russian Federation

Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation, and Grigory Karasin, a State Secretary and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, exchanged on July, 30 ratifications of the Treaty on Alliance and Integration (signed on March, 18 between the two states by Presidents Tibilov and Putin).

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of a First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia

Under the President Decree Andrey Tskhovrebov was appointed as a First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on July 27, 2015.
July 28, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the delivery presentation of copies of credentials 

Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation, delivered to Grigory Karasin, a State Secretary and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, copies of credentials on July, 24.
A fruitful dialogue on subjects of mutual interest related to further development of friendly interstate relations and cooperation between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation took place.
The parties emphasized concurring opinions on a range of current international issues.
July 24, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: South Ossetia Foreign Minister Kazbulat Tskhovrebov Interview to Interfax News Agency
News_Shorts:
- Mr. Tskhovrebov, what are the primary goals set for the Foreign Department? 
- According to the Constitution of the Republic of South Ossetia, the foreign policy of the state is defined by the President. Our priority is development of foreign policy general strategy for the next months and submission of relevant proposals to the President. The Head of state visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on July, 10. He emphasized the importance of diplomatic service, noted the role of foreign policy department in strengthening South Ossetia statehood and set the main objectives for the ministry. It is execution of these tasks defined by the President the function of the ministry. Together with the department officers we will do our best to justify the President expectations.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the procedures of obtaining permission to enter the Republic of South Ossetia

South Ossetia citizens have the right to apply to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to issue an admission to the Republic for foreign visitors. A copy of passport of a citizen of the Republic, data on the invited persons and a document confirming family ties (if relevant) should be attached to the application. Consideration period – up to 10 calendar days.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: July, 17 saw a special statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia condemning military exercises, staged by the 58th Army of the Russian Federation in Southern Military District and South Ossetia, and naming them “acts of provocation”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Leonid Tibilov hosted a meeting with Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, and Znaur Gassiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation on July, 15.
Issues concerning the work of the Ministry were discussed and the political course was marked out during the meeting. 
The President emphasized the activity of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, one of the most important departments of the Republic, has to be aimed at strengthening South Ossetia statehood and enhancing the Republic’s image in Russian sight and at international level. Moreover, the President suggested working out the next few days an agenda of a meeting with other ambassadors and South Ossetia representatives in countries we have interstate relations with.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Once again the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia declared of transferring South Ossetia-Georgian boundary deeper into Georgian territory while establishing entry-resistant constructions. The planned visit of Donald Tusk, President of the European Council, whom the Georgian party tried to bring to border obviously with provocative purposes is also connected with alleged violation of border by South Ossetia representatives.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The professional Day of peacekeepers was celebrated on July, 14 in the Republic of South Ossetia. This day the Joint Peacekeeping Forces entered the Georgian-Ossetian conflict zone in 1992. For 16 years the peacekeeping forces have been the only guarantor of peace in the region and faced first attacks of Georgian army in August, 2008. The feat of these heroes will be kept in memory of South Ossetian people.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the newly appointed Foreign Minister was introduced to the department officers on July, 10 when Leonid Tibilov, the President of the Republic visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. As the President noted, “the recently appointed minister is not a new person in the department and is well known to the team and is on to the work of the department entrusted to him”.
The President emphasized the Ministry of Foreign Affairs is the main department that is in charge of foreign policy tasks set by the President in general and strengthening the international positions of our state in particular.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of a Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia

Under the President Decree Kazbulat Tskhovrebov was appointed as a Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on July 9, 2015.
July 10, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Joint statement of South Ossetian and Abkhazian delegations on the Geneva International Discussions
News_Shorts:
The UN General Assembly has been accepting draft resolution on refugees and displaced persons from South Ossetia and Abkhazia prepared by Georgian party for several years already. Delivering again and again the same writing of the document Georgia tries to impose on international community a unilateral politicized corrupt vision of the problem of refugees to support their non-legitimate territorial claims.
The latest draft resolution of the UN General Assembly on refugees and displaced people that was presented by Georgia in June, 2015 and was similar to the previous one approved by the UN GA, refers to exercising the right of all internally displaced people, refugees and their descendants to return to “their homes located on whole territory of Georgia, including Abkhazia and South Ossetia”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the appointment of an Ambassador Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation

Under the President Decree Znaur Gassiev was appointed as the Ambassador Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation on June 26, 2015.
Short biodata:
Znaur Gassiev was born on May 13, 1974 in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Paata Zakareishvili, Georgia State Minister for Reconciliation and Civil Equality, declared on December, 8 that Georgian authorities were ready to conduct any form of dialogue, including negotiations with South Ossetia authorities. In his report on the work conducted by the ministry Mr.Zakareishvili stated that it had concentrated on “approaching Abkhazian and Ossetian public” that allowed binding relationship between the people and promoted confidence-building.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Concerning the results of the 30th round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions where missions from South Ossetia (headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement), Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA and representatives of the EU, the UN and the OSCE was held on December 9-10, 2014 in Geneva.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Istanbul hosted an international festival “Culture Days of Ossetia in Turkey” organized by Culture Ministries of Russia and the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania, supported by “Alan”, the Ossetian community in Turkey that have celebrated the 25th anniversary this year.
A delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia represented by David Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the RSO, and Kosta Pukhaev, the First Deputy Head of the RSO President Administration, as well as a delegation of the Republic of North Ossetia-Alania headed by Lyudmila Tokaeva, the Vice-chairman of the RNO-Alania Parliament, and Fatima Khabalova, the Minister of Culture of the RNO-Alania, participated in the festivities.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The government of Hungary denied South Ossetian athletes visas so that the delegation of our Republic couldn't participate in the ConIFA European Football Cup that would take place in Hungary. Definitely this decision was met with indignation in the Republic.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetian mission, hosted a meeting with the Co-Chairmen of the Geneva International Discussions representing the EU, OSCE and the UN, who arrived to Tskhinval within a visit anticipating the coming round of the Discussions, on June, 11.
Issues concerning security about South Ossetia-Georgian border and the agenda of the coming 32nd round of the discussions, which are planned for June, 1, were talked over.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The Second Forum of Young Diplomats was held in Moscow on June 2-3, 2015. Representatives of Abkhazia, Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and South Ossetia diplomatic departments took part in the forum. A wide range of international agenda items was discussed on an informal meeting with leaders of Russian Foreign Ministry and experts in sphere of international relations that was held in friendly atmosphere. Igor Morgulov, the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation and other officials representing the ministry, Leonid Slutsky, the Chairman of the Russian State Duma Committee for the CIS Affairs, Eurasian Integration and Relations with Compatriots, as well as other experts became guests of the forum.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the resolution on refugees supported by the United Nations General Assembly 

Georgian draft resolution on problem of displaced persons and refugees from South Ossetia and Abkhazia was supported for the 7th time by the United Nations General Assembly on June 3, 2015. 75 countries voted “for” and 16 countries voted “against” adopting the resolution. It is good that the number of countries opposing the writing of the document grew for 3 units.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Concern on human rights protecting system in the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Abkhazia was marked in the quarterly report of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia and expressed by Ivica Dacic, the Foreign Minister of Serbia. As it was stated, “fully functioning OSCE mission should be returned to the Republics and access to the territories should be provided for international observers”.

News_Titles: South Ossetian Acting Foreign Minister Kazbulat Tskhovrebov Interview to South Ossetia newspaper
News_Shorts: - The professional day of South Ossetia diplomacy is celebrated on May, 28. It is possible to say that South Ossetia diplomacy came to a new, qualitative level compared to the time the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of RSO had been established? What is the main focus area of the activity conducted by South Ossetian Foreign Ministry, if we take into consideration the current political situation?

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, and Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Alexey Dvinyanin, Nikita Zhukov and Marat Kulakhmetov, representatives of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation and members of Russian delegation on the Geneva International Discussions, on May 28, 2015.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
International conference “National Independence and International Interdependence” organized by a parliament group and Mediterranen Mare Nostrum Federation supported by the Regional Council of Sardinia was hold in Sassari, Sardinia on May, 16, 2015.
Professor Mauro Murgia, the President of Italy-South Ossetia Friendship Society, delivered a greeting message from the President of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The signed treaty between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation which allegedly “does violence to sovereignty and territorial integrity of Georgia and is not legally binding” was condemned by the Council of Europe Deputy Ministers Committee within discussion of the agenda “The Council of Europe and the Georgian conflict” on May 12, 2015.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: May, 5 saw a meeting of German and Georgian Foreign Ministers, when Frank-Walter Steinmaier spoke once again in support of “territorial integrity of Georgia” and declared non-recognition of the Treaty on Alliance and Integration signed between South Ossetia and the Russian Federation. The fact that Germany is supporting Georgia isn't new.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Diplomatic missions of Lugansk and Donetsk People’s Republics of in the Republic of South Ossetia were officially opened today. Natalya Horsheva, the Chief of Administration of LPR Head, was heading the delegation of the Republic. The delegation of DPR was headed by Alexander Coffman, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Kosta Pukhaev, the First Deputy Head of RSO President Administration, Alan Kochiev, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Rodion Siukaev, the State Councilor of the President on social problems, participated in the ceremony on South Ossetian side.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Daniel Tibilov, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua met in Managua with Samuel Santos Lopez, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, on April 23, 2015.
Copies of credentials were delivered to the Minister during the meeting.

News_Titles: Message of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic South Ossetia
News_Shorts: President Tibilov hosted a Nauruan delegation headed by David Adeang, the Vice President the Republic, on April, 22. The Vice-speaker of the Parliament Akua Renin, the Deputy Minister of Finance Hunt Martin and MP Buramen Cyril were members of the delegation. Konstantin Kochiev, State Councilor of the President, Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Igor Kochiev, the Parliamental Committee on Foreign Policy and Inter-Parliament Communications Chairman, participated in the meeting on South Ossetian side.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
April, 21 has seen opening of a photo exhibition “South Ossetia: the Country and People” prepared by Italian photographer Leonardo Mattioli. The exhibition was organized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the RSO together with Italy - South Ossetia Friendship Society, with assistance of the Ministry of Culture of the RSO in cinema and concert hall “Chermen”.
Alan Kochiev, the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Erik Pukhaev, the Deputy Prime Minister, Madina Ostaeva, the Minister of Culture, Professor Mauro Murgia, the President of Italy - South Ossetia Friendship Society, and public representatives participated in the ceremony.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Kazbulat Tskhovrebov, the First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, met a delegation from the Republic of Nauru headed by David Adeang, the Minister Assisting the President, the Minister for Finance and Sustainable Development and the Minister for Justice, on April 16, 2015 in Moscow.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A delegation from Italy headed by Professor Mauro Murgia, the President of Italy - South Ossetia Friendship Society is on an official visit to the Republic these days.
A photo exhibition “South Ossetia: the Country and People” prepared by Italian photographer Leonardo Mattioli and organized by Professor Mauro Murgia with the assistance of South Ossetian Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Culture will be opened on April, 21 in cinema and concert hall “Chermen”. 
The opening ceremony will start at 11:00.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Daniel Tibilov, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, is on an official visit to Venezuela.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Diplomatic Mission of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Lugansk People’s Republic was opened on April 16, 2015.
Igor Plotnitsky, the Head of the LPR, host a meeting with representatives of the RSO after the opening ceremony. The parties expressed confidence that the work of the Mission would strengthen friendly ties between South Ossetia and Lugansk and help in developing bilateral relations in humanitarian, economic and other spheres. 
April 17, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Diplomatic Mission of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Donetsk People’s Republic started its work in Donetsk on April, 16.
At the official opening ceremony the DPR public representatives expressed confidence that the established Mission would promote developing relations between Donbass and the Republic of South Ossetia in humanitarian, economic and other spheres. 
Similar office is supposed to be opened in the capital of South Ossetia in short term.
April 16, 2015, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: As Giorgi Margvelashvili stated in his annual report to the Parliament made on March, 31, the main objectives for Georgia are unity and integrity of the state. For this reason “Abkhazia and South Ossetia should obligatory be deokkupated”. Alongside with this Georgian leader considered valuable to show care of “the Abkhazian and the Ossetian identity preservation, political and cultural rights of the people exercising that can be guaranteed by the European Georgia”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Consular agency of the Republic of South Ossetia was officially opened in Vladikavkaz on November, 21, 2014.
D. S. Kulumbegov, the Prime Minister of RSO, D. G. Sanakoev the Minister of Foreign Affairs of RSO, S. K. Takoev, the Prime Minister of RNO-Alania, E.K. Kargiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Russian Federation in RSO, and other officials participated in the ceremony.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, heading South Ossetian mission, organized a working meeting with the Co-Chairmen of the Geneva International Discussions representing the EU, OSCE and the UN, who arrived to Tskhinval within a visit anticipating the coming round of the Discussions.
Each subject area that will be under negotiation on the coming 30th round of the discussions, which are planned for December, was talked over.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On October 29 D. G. Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, received Jan Mishkots, the new Head of the ICRC mission in South Ossetia.
Current terms of bilateral cooperation and further activity of the organization in South Ossetia were discussed. The Minister marked the importance of the work carried out by the ICRC in the Republic and expressed words of gratitude for the implemented projects.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Declarations of mad love to the Ossetian and Abkhazian people are made by Georgia recently. Georgian mass media bristles with quotations of Georgian leaders who are vying with each other in offers of brotherhood, autonomy as a part of Georgia or European perspective.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Irakliy Alasania, the Minister of Defence of Georgia, declared on October, 14 that Georgia would begin the process of South Ossetia and Abkhazia "deokkupation" by means of the international community pressure. What is more, the normative acts approved by parliaments of the two states have no international legal value for Georgia.

News_Titles: The Message of South Ossetian delegation for the mass media
News_Shorts:
Concerning the results of the 29th round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on October 7-8, 2014 in Geneva. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Pertaining to Georgian leader G. Margvelashvili's speech on the World Economic Forum

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
David Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, received Chingiz Rayimbekov, a delegate from the Tskhinval office of the Defense Department of the International Committee of the Red Cross on September, 14.
Terms of the ICRC activity in South Ossetia were discussed. Mr. Rayimbekov reported on the results of the work conducted by the mission in South Ossetia for the last months. An exchange of opinions on a number of issues of mutual interest took place.
September 24, 2014, Tskhinval

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On a telephone conversation between the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia and the secretary of state – the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The 5th annual conference organized by Russian residents in South Ossetia was held in Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic of South Ossetia on September, 16. The main subject of the conference was "The multi-vector humanitarian course of Russia in the “near abroad” and Russian compatriots in South Ossetia".

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Ossetian mission on the Geneva International Discussions headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, played host to the Co-chairmen of the Discussions, who visited the Republic on September, 16, 2014.
Issues concerning preparation for the forthcoming 29th round of the Discussions that is going to be held on October, 7-8, 2014 have been talked over.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The Treaty on Alliance and Integration between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation was signed on March, 18. Signing of the document drew a wide response. Refusing to recognize the existing reality, Georgia and some western countries claimed the signed Treaty to be a violation of international law.

News_Titles: The message of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
Concerning the results of the 31st round of the Geneva International Discussions

Regular round of the Geneva International Discussions was held on March 17-18, 2015 in Geneva. Official mission from South Ossetia, headed by Murat Dzhioev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement, missions from Abkhazia, Georgia, Russia, the USA as well as representatives of the EU, the UN and OSCE took part in negotiations.

News_Titles: South Ossetian Foreign Minister David Sanakoev Interview to REGNUM News Agency
News_Shorts:
Today, on March, 18, The Treaty on Alliance and Integration between South Ossetia and Russia is being singed in Moscow. David Sanakoev, the head of foreign policy department of RSO, informed REGNUM news agency what positive changes can happen in the Republic and why did the treaty with Russia become the reason for non-confidence vote delivering.
— Definitely it’s symbolic that the signing is scheduled for March, 18. A year ago the Crimea joined Russia. Today, despite the difficulties that arose during discussion, a finalized and modified (including by Russian departments) writing of the contract is going to be signed by Leonid Tibilov, the President of South Ossetia, and Vladimir Putin, the President of Russia. I am sure this signing will mark the next stage in development of interstate relations between our countries.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: David Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, hosted a meeting with Jan Mishkots, the Chief Representative of the International Committee of the Red Cross in the Republic of South Ossetia, on February, 26 in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: David Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, took part in a news conference that was held within the project “Open government” and run in the press center of the State Committee on Information and Press on February, 25.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Unexpected announcement was made by Zurab Abashidze, the Georgian Prime Minister’s Special Representative for Relations with Russia. “Provided, Russia promotes and encourages a direct dialogue between us and the Ossetians, us and the Abkhazians we are ready to set these questions connected with statehoods aside and even do not discuss them for some time".

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia

February 18, 2015 has seen the statement made by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia in which the signed agreement on the Ossetian-Russian boundary was criticized and the world community was called for “taking effective measures preventing Russian activities against Georgia”.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
“The Agreement on the frontier between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Russian Federation” has been signed on February 18, 2015 in Moscow. The ceremony took place within the official visit of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D. G. Sanakoev to the capital of the Russian Federation. The agreement was signed by the Ministers of Foreign Affairs - D. G. Sanakoev on South Ossetian side and S. V. Lavrov on Russian side.
The Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs A.K. Kochiev, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of RSO in the Russian Federation D. N. Medoev, the Plenipotentiary of the President of RSO on post-conflict settlement M. K. Dzhioev also participated in the ceremony on the Ossiatan side.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A monument dedicated to a participant of the Civil war in Spain (1936-1939), a national hero of the USSR and the prototype of the central character of the world known novel "For whom the bell tolls" written by Ernest Hemingway Haji-Umar D. Mamsurov was opened on February, 16 in Fuenlabrad.
D.G. Sanakoev, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, an official mission from North Ossetia headed by the President of the Republic Taimuraz Mamsurov, Khadzhi-Umar's daughter Asya and grandson Sergio Hernandez took part in the monument’s official opening ceremony.
Words of gratitude to Spanish people who keep in mind the names of heroes who fought against the Nazi regime were express by David Sanakoev on behalf of the leaders of the Republic of South Ossetia. This important event, stated the minister, is one more occasion to remind the world what fascism that has sprouted today again in Ukraine implies.

News_Titles: Press release of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
The Plenipotentiary of the President of RSO on post-conflict settlement M. K. Dzhioev heading representatives of the Ossetian side on the Geneva International Discussions met the Co-chairmen of the Geneva Discussions who visited Tskhinval on February, 16.
Current issues of the forthcoming 31st round of the discussions that is held on March, 17-18, 2015 has been talked over.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
- Mr. Sanakoev, taking into consideration the current situation in Ukraine and imposed sanctions, the situation in Russia and its allies can possibly be characterized as extremely intense. Russia is the main strategic partner of South Ossetia. How are security issues and the issues of the borders reinforcement solved, taking into account that by this time the contract on non-use of force with Georgia hasn’t been signed? 
- Definitely, the world now is facing a difficult period when a new regime of international relations is being generated. This is going to be a long-lasting process with hardly predictable future. New problems, challenges concerning human security and the humanity development arise annually. Thus Russia should constantly look for contemporary means to ensure stability worldwide.

News_Titles: Comment by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the statement of Jens Stoltenberg, Secretary General of NATO 

A number of statements made by Jens Stoltenberg, Secretary General of NATO, marked the press conference organized after the NATO -Georgia committee meeting. Russia was urged to call back the recognition of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. Anxiety over the forthcoming agreement signing between South Ossetia and Russia was expressed.

News_Titles: Information of the press bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 27 of December the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev played host for the delegation of Donetsk People Republic MFA headed by DPR Foreign Minister A. I. Kofman who came to Tskhinval with a working visit.
In the course of a detailed conversation were discussed a perspective directions of bilateral cooperation in different realms as well as a development of political dialog in the view of recognition of Donetsk People Republic by the Republic of South Ossetia. A separate issue of discussion became perspectives of constructive interaction between the foreign ministries of RSO and DPR.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Military training centers for NATO members and its partners will be created on territory of Georgia announced the representative of the alliance. Next manoeuvers of NATO will also take place in Georgia this year. What is more, such maneuvers will be staged in the country regularly.

News_Titles: Information of the press bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 2 of September the delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia headed by the Foreign Minister D. G. Sanakoev took part in the celebrations in Tiraspol dedicated to the 24th anniversary of Transdnistrian Moldovan Republic establishment.
Within the frameworks of festive events eventuated the meeting of Southossetian delegation with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Transdnistrian Moldovan Republic N. V. Shtanski. During the meeting were discussed the issues of priority directions of cooperation and particularly, on the line of foreign agencies. Transdnistrian side transferred to the delegation of South Ossetia draft warding of renewed Agreement of friendship and cooperation for the following revision and coordination. Decision of necessity of renewing of existing agreement had been taken by the Presidents of South Ossetia and Transdnistria Leonid Tibilov and Evgeny Shevchuk earlier. The parties also discussed the perspectives of conducting in 2015 quadripartite meeting of Foreign Ministers of South Ossetia, Transdnistria, Abkhazia and Nagorno-Karabakh.

News_Titles: Commentary of the representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 1 of October during the meeting with UNDP Head Helen Clark the Minister of Foreign Affairs Maya Panjicidze stated that UNDP projects in Abkhazia can be realized in South Ossetia.
UNDP is, no doubt, important and useful agency of recognized value and merit. However, taking decisions of possibility for one or another international agency to fulfill its activity at the territory of sovereign state – the Republic of South Ossetia are authorized only competitive organs of state power of the Republic, but not Georgian foreign office.

News_Titles: The commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to the statement of I. Garibashvili at UN GA 69th session 

On 26 of September Georgia’s Prime Minister Irakli Garibashvili made a speech at the 69th session of UN General Assembly. During the speech Garibashvili declared that Georgia “still aims to settle peacefully August war 2008 and put an end to Russian occupation”, and “to become a supplier of security, not just its user”. Garibashvili also noted the annually enhancing support of UN member states on Georgia’s resolutions pertaining to refugees and IDPs and called all UN members to continue this practice in future.

News_Titles: The commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining the statement of G. Margvelashvili

The President of Georgia after visiting the military airdrome and obviously satisfied by observing Georgian military helicopters flights made very strange statement that Georgia plans to regain the territories of South Ossetia and Abkhazia solely by peaceful means “and if Russia recognize that Abkhazia and South Ossetia are part of Georgia it will no longer be the enemy of Georgia”.

News_Titles: Information or the press-bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 8 of September Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Abkhazia O. I. Botsiev arrived to Tskhinval for consultations.
Ambassador met with the President of the Republic of South Ossetia L. H. Tibilov. The meeting was also participated by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D. G. Sanakoev.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: South Ossetian leadership stated more than once that first priority in foreign policy for South Ossetia is further integration with Russian Federation. The process of integration between two states is going on intensively. To date there are signed more than 70 international agreements, a number of new agreements are presently in process of elaboration, besides, negotiations of signing of new agreement of friendship and cooperation are under way.

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic if South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Amendments made on August 4, 2014 in the Federal law “Of citizenship of Russian Federation” and some legislative acts of Russian Federation oblige Russian citizens to inform about availability of foreign citizenship, residence permit or any other actual document of permission to permanent residence in foreign state.

News_Titles: Information of press bureau of Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Of appointment of Sanakoev David Georgievich at the position of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia

On 14 of July 2014 by decree of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia L. H. Tibilov Sanakoev David Georgievich was appointed at the position of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia.
Tskhinval, July 14, 2014

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Pertaining to NATO summit in Wales

At Wales NATO summit conducted on 4-5 September Georgia received a considerable stack of “Enhanced cooperation” that although not granting a membership in Alliance but empowers Georgia’s access to intelligence, to participation in military trainings and strengthens cooperation in defense sphere. Besides, United States through the head of Defense Ministry Chuck Hagel who met with his Georgian college in Tbilisi on September 7, called for Russia to withdraw troops from Georgian border.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A working meeting between members of delegation of South Ossetia at Geneva Discussions headed by Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution Murat Jioev with Co-Chairmen of Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia, representing EU, OSCE and UN, took place in Tskhinval on 15 June 2014.
The main subject of the meeting was devoted to preparatory work on 29th round of Geneva Discussions planned for beginning of October.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Amendments to the Federal Law of RF on Citizenship were made in June 2014. According to the amendments that come into effect in August 2014, those citizen of Russia that have double citizenship are obliged to inform Federal Migration Services. Information concealment is under administrative and criminal responsibility.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: During the last few days at different international venues many high-ranking officials often make statements that living conditions in South Ossetia are steadily deteriorating and human rights being violated everywhere. At the same time western curators of Georgia repeat relentlessly that Georgia is a display stand of successful changes and flagship of high-pitched democracy.

News_Titles: Joint statement of delegations of Republic of Abkhazia and Republic of South Ossetia at Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia
News_Shorts: During the last few years UN General Assembly has been accepting draft resolution on refugees and IDPs from Abkhazia and South Ossetia, repeating the content of the document every year, Georgia tires to impose on the International Community a one-sided, politicized and biased approach to the refugee problem to back up its illegal territorial claims.

News_Titles: Announcement of the delegation of South Ossetia for mass-media
News_Shorts:
On 28th round of International Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia 

Another round of International Geneva Discussions took place in Geneva on 17-18 June 2014. At the meeting participated representatives of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, US as well as representatives of EU, UN and OSCE. Delegation of South Ossetia was headed by Presidential Envoy on post-conflict resolution M.K. Jioev.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Parliamentary elections took place in South Ossetia on 8 June 2014. More than 60% of the registered electorate participated in the vote. The voters were able to give their preferences to any of the registered nine parties that participated in the elections. International observers from 12 countries did not register a single violation of the electoral legislation and confirmed its compliance with high electoral standards. They also noted accomplishment of the electoral procedures, their transparency and absolute democracy.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the refugee resolution accepted by the UN General Assembly 

On 5 June 2014 the UN General Assembly accepted resolution on refugees initiated by Georgia. The document reflects falsified, one-sided and politicized vision of the problem imposed on the International Community by Georgia and its sponsors. The aim of the document was to claim again territories that do not belong to Georgia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 3-4 June Tskhinval was visited by a delegation of from Eritrea headed by Minister of Foreign Affairs of Eritrea Mr. Osman Saleh.
During a comprehensive meeting, that took place at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the sides discussed perspectives of bilateral relations and potential cooperation in different fields. 
The negotiations were carried out in a constructive a friendly manner. 
After the meeting the sides answered questions of mass-media representatives. 
Tskhinval, 4 June 2014

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On refugee draft resolution submitted by the Georgian delegation at the UN General Assembly

On 19 May 2014 the Georgian delegation submitted to UN General Assembly draft resolution on refuges and IDPs from South Ossetia and Abkhazia for the sixth time. Voting on this resolution is planned in the first decade of June.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A telephone conversation between the acting in charge Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of Abkhazia Vyacheslav Chirikba took place on 30th May.
During the conversation David Sanakoev noted that South Ossetia is closely following the situation in Abkhazia. He also hoped that political wisdom of people of Abkhazia will allow to remain within the constitutional framework and resolve the situation through a political dialogue by peaceful means.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: The UN High Commissioner for Human Right Ms. Navi Pillay made a number of statements on situation in South Ossetia, during her visit to Georgia, that have nothing to do with the reality. According to the High Commissioner South Ossetia became a ‘black hole’ and ‘one of the most difficult places to access’ where ‘living conditions are steadily deteriorating’ She noted that “despite the multiple attempts and appeals on behalf of the UN General Secretary, we have been denied access to Abkhazia and South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: 20th May is a Memory and Mourning Day in South Ossetia. On this day in 1992 Georgian extremist shot down a group a refugees from South Ossetia on a bypassing road near village Zar. Among them were mainly children, women and elderly. 33 people were killed, aged between 11 to 72 years, 16 were injured.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 14 May 2014 Republic of South Ossetia was visited by Co-chairman of Geneva Discussions on Peace and Stability and Transcaucasia. The delegation met with South Ossetian participants of the Geneva Discussions headed by Presidential Envoy on Post-Conflict resolution M.K. Jioev. 
During the meeting were discussed issues related to 28th round of Geneva Discussions planned for 17-18 June 2014. 
The participants underlined again the importance of a legally binding document on nonuse of force to be signed between Georgia and South Ossetia as well as the need in joint work on demarcation of the state border line.
The Co-Chairmen were also informed about introduction of new permits that allow to cross state border between South Ossetia and Georgia in a simplified manner.
The sides noted the importance of the IPRM that facilitates effective resolution of issues related to security in the bordering regions. Above that were discussed humanitarian topics.
South Ossetian side emphasized questions related to persons missing in action, citizens of South Ossetia illegally convicted to in Georgia and possibility for mutual release of the prisoners.
After the meeting the Co-Chairmen met with South Ossetian human rights activists and relatives of citizens of South Ossetia convicted in Georgia. 
 Tskhinval, 14 May 2014

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia informs that deadline for submission of applications for a competitive exam to Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO) of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation is on 23 May 2014.
Competitive exam, consisting of an interview and admissions examinations, will take place on 11-12 June 2014.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On state border line denotation 
Georgian diplomacy is making titanic efforts to find direct or indirect support for their claims on territories of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. Western sponsors of Georgia express solidarity with Tbilisi one in a while to support their protégé. Georgia is especially concerned with works carried out by South Ossetia on denotation of the state border line. However, Georgia was able to rush its interpretation of the situation at some of the European venues to expressed ‘concerns’ about ‘installation of barbed-wire’, ‘restriction of freedom of movement’ that was presented in Tbilisi as success Georgian diplomacy.
Meanwhile the reality is that there are no diplomatic relations between South Ossetia and Georgia, therefore, there are no agreements that regulate border crossing. South Ossetia is a sovereign state, the border regime, its denotation and arrangement is regulated by legislation of Republic of South Ossetia.
In the frame of the Agreement between Republic of South Ossetia and Russian Federation on joint efforts for protection of the state border, protection of state border is jointly done by South Ossetian and Russian border guards. 
All the attempts of Georgia to dictate South Ossetia its position are hopeless. It would have been much better for future of Georgia to follow the example of Russia and negotiate with Republic of South Ossetia delimitation and demarcation of the border line instead of looking for support in Strasburg and Vienna.
It should be noted that attempts to interfere into internal affairs of South Ossetia, a sovereign state, are hopeless. At the same time we confirm our committal to norm and fundamental principals of the International Law and count on their observance by all parties of the International Community. 
 Tskhinval, 7 May 2014

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 5 May acting Minister of Foreign Affairs D.G. Sanakoev received Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Bolivar Republic of Venezuela Mr. Juan Vicente Paredes Torrealba. 
During the meeting the Ambassador presented copies of credentials to the acting Minister. David Sanakoev congratulated Juan Vicente with his new appointment, wished him fruitful work and hoped for active cooperation in strengthening of intestate relations between Republic of South Ossetia and Bolivar Republic of Venezuela.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 4-6 May capital of Republic of South Ossetia Tskhinval is going to be visited by Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela to Republic of South Ossetia Juan Vicente Paredes Torrealba.
Official Presentation of Credentials by the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela Juan Vicente Paredes Torrealba to President of the Republic of South Ossetia Leonid Tibilov and copies of the Credentials to Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev is going to take place on 5th May.

News_Titles: Commentary of the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev
News_Shorts: Information about escalation of violence in Ukraine is raising a lot of concerns about the fate of this country. The de-facto authorities, whose legitimacy is based on maidan, are fighting against people of south – east regions of Ukraine. National army, consisting of members of radical nationalistic organizations, is shooting down peaceful population regardless their age and gender. Assault detachments of the regime are carrying out large-scale deterrent actions around the country.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Today morning Kiev regime sent against peaceful population of Ukrainian city of Slavyansk troops with armed vehicles, aviation, artillery and detachments of extremists of the Right sector. Use of armed forces against their own people means complete lack of understanding of the aspirations of the people of South-East of the country as well as lack of sense of reality with the people that declared themselves as Government of Ukraine.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Consultations between the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev and State Secretary, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation G.B. Karasin took place in Moscow on 25 April 2014.
An exchange of opinion on the main issues of the bilateral relations took place at the meeting. Were defined the main directions of further cooperation between the two countries.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A working meeting between the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation S.V. Lavrov and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Abkhazia V.A. Chikirba took place in Moscow on 25 April 2014.
In the frame of the meeting was signed a plan of consultations between the Ministries for 2014-2015.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the working visit of the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev to Italy 

A working visit of the acting Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia to Italy took place during 27-31 March 2014. In the frame of the visit the Minister carried out a number of meetings in Assisi, Belluno and Venice.
In Assisi was carried out a meeting with first advisor of Assisi Mayor Francesco Minani. During the meeting were discussed perspectives for economic, cultural and educational cooperation between Tskhinval and Assisi.

News_Titles: Announcement of the South Ossetian delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
27th round of Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia 

27th round of Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia took place in Geneva on 25-26 March 2014. At the meeting participated representatives of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, United States as well as representatives of EU, UN and OSCE. South Ossetian delegation was headed by Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution M.K. Jioev.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Agreement on acceptation of Republic of Crimea and Sevastopol into Russian Federation and creation of new subjects within Russian Federation was signed today in Moscow.
South Ossetia welcomes decision on unification of Republic of Crimea and Sevastopol with Russian Federation. This event brought into life realization of the right of self determination of multinational Crimea is a triumph of historic fairness and supremacy of law.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
South Ossetia is closely following developments in Crimes where an nationwide referendum on determination of the Republic’s future took place. More than 96% participants of the referendum voted for unification with Russian Federation. 
As reported by International observers from more than 20 counties the referendum was carried out with enthusiasm in festive atmosphere, with full observation of the legislation, international standards and democratic procedures.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
South Ossetia is closely following developments in Crimes where an nationwide referendum on determination of the Republic’s future took place. More than 96% participants of the referendum voted for unification with Russian Federation.
As reported by International observers from more than 20 counties the referendum was carried out with enthusiasm in festive atmosphere, with full observation of the legislation, international standards and democratic procedures.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A working meeting between members of South Ossetian delegation to Geneva Discussions, headed by Murat Jioev, Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution and Co-chairmen of Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia from EU, OSCE and UN took place in Tskhinval on 11 March 2014 in anticipation of the forthcoming round of the discussions.
The main subject of the meeting was on preparations to the 27th round of Geneva Discussions planned for 25-26 March 2014. 
During the meting the sides discussed security situation in the border adjoining territories between South Ossetia and Georgia and ways of stabilization including efficiency upgrading of the existing joint incident prevention and response mechanisms (IPRM).

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the situation in Ukraine
Situation in Ukraine, where in the result of a coup Kiev and many cities of Western Ukraine were taken over by armed radical extremists, is closely followed in South Ossetia. Activities of the extremists are getting more large scale and aggressive.

News_Titles: Commentary of the acting in charge Minister of Foreign Affairs D.G. Sanakoev for RIA Novosti
News_Shorts: On 12 February State Minister of Georgia for Reconciliation and Civil Equality of Georgia Paata Zakareishvili, during his speech at the Washington Carnegie Centre underlined that ‘ties of South Ossetia and Abkhazia with Russia are not natural and historic’ and ‘the only resource of Russia in the region is barbed wire’.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
From 28 February to 3 March Republic of South Ossetia was visited by a delegation from Italy and San Marino headed by President of Friendship Society Italy-South Ossetia, Professor Mauro Murjia.
The delegation was received by Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev. During the meeting it was underlined that extension and strengthening of trade, economic and cultural ties is beneficial for longstanding relations between the sides in the frame of Friendship Society Italy-South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 28 February acting in charge Minister of foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev received from the newly appointed Ambassador of Republic of Abkhazia to Republic of South Ossetia A.M. Elbakiev copies of the letters of credence.
D.G. Sanakoev congratulated A.M. Elbakiev with his new appointment and wished him success in extending the bilateral ties.
A.M. Elbakiev expressed readiness to make everything possible for further strengthening off the cooperation between Abkhazia and South Ossetia. 
 Tskhinval, 28 February 2014

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: During the last days there were of plenty of statements made by the Georgian authorities for mass-media to express their ‘deep concerns’ about resumption of fencing works along the state border line of Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Attention of the whole world is attached to the opening of ХХII winter Olympic Games, the opening will take place on 7 February 2014 in Russian Federation, in Sochi Russian Federation as the organizer and of the Olympic Games called on participants of armed conflicts, regardless countries and continents, to declare ‘Olympic ceasefire’ during the Olympic Games.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
On appointment of Elbakiev Alan as an Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of Republic of Abkhazia in Republic of South Ossetia

On 30 January Alan Mukharbekovich Elbakiev was appointed as the Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of Republic of Abkhazia in Republic of South Ossetia by Decree of the President of Republic of Abkhazia Alexander Ankvab.
Bio data:
Elbakiev Alan Mukharbekovich was born on 5 January 1959 in village Sazalet of South-Ossetian Autonomous Oblast.

News_Titles: Briefing of the acting in charge Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev for republican mass-media on results of the trip to Italy
News_Shorts:
David Sanakoev, Minister of Foreign Affairs of RSO: Dear journalists!
In compliance with the external policy of our state, determined by the Guidelines of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, our Constitution and the annual Message of the President, a business trip to Italy took place. The purpose of the trip was to extend our political, economic and cultural ties. We carried out a number of meetings with representatives of political parties of Italy and representatives of Italian business. We have been working on economic cooperation to attract investments to our economy. Our Italian colleagues and friends supported us in that.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts: During 10-20 January 2014 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev and Mayor of Tskhinval Alan Alborov were on business trip to Italy. The purpose of the visit was to sign a Friendship Agreement between Tskhinval and Lanusei with participation of Friendship Association Italy - South Ossetia. On 13 January 2014 the agreement was signed in Lanusei between Mayor of Tskhinval Alan Alborov and Mayor of Lanusei Davide Ferreli. The document should facilitate improvement of relations between the cities, strengthen friendship and cultural ties between Italian and South-Ossetian people.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to Informational Agency ‘Res’
News_Shorts:
- Tell us about achievements of the MFA in 2013?
- In 2013 Ministry of Foreign Affairs carried out its activities according to Constitution of Republic of South Ossetia, legislation, norms and standards of the Republic. The main direction of the Ministry’s activities is development and realization of a common foreign policy of Republic of South Ossetia, determined by President of RSO. These tasks are entrusted to MFA by Provisions “On Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia”, Decree of President of Republic of South Ossetia “On coordinating role of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia in realization of a common foreign policy of Republic of South Ossetia” from 27 April 2005. In 2013 it has been 5 years from the date of recognition of the sovereignty of South Ossetia by Russia. In that sense 2013 is a special year for South Ossetia. President Leonid Tibilov in his address to the nation and parliament on 30 April 2013 confirmed that the main strategic partner of South Ossetia is Russia. Therefore, further development and extension of friendly ties with Russian Federation is a priority for us.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 31 December 2013 President of Republic of South Ossetia Tibilov Leonid Kharitonovich issued a decree to release citizen of Georgia Jeparov Teimuraz Savelevich, sentenced in 2010 to 13 years of imprisonment by Supreme Court of Republic of South Ossetia as per article 278 of Criminal Code of RF.

News_Titles: Announcement of the delegation of South Ossetia for mass-media
News_Shorts:
On 26-th round of Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability in Transcaucasia

Another round of Geneva Discussions of Security and Stability in Transcaucasia took place in Geneva on 17-18 December 2013. At the session participated representatives of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, United States as well as representatives of the EU, UN, OSCE. Delegation of South Ossetia was headed by Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution M. K. Jioev.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to newspaper ‘South Ossetia’
News_Shorts:
- During the summit on Eastern partnership in Vilnius, Georgia initialed agreement on association with the EU, final signing is planned for next year but they already announced plans on economic involvement of South Ossetia and Abkhazia into joint projects between European Union and Georgia. Above that, during the last year and a half, particularly after assumption of office by the Georgian Dream, representatives of international organizations and some politically committed Russian experts more and more often find it necessary to depoliticize issues between RSO and Georgia and start rebuilding relations in economic and humanitarian spheres. How is South Ossetia going to build its foreign policy, considering these factors, and how South Ossetia is going to react on the attempts of its involvement into economic and humanitarian projects with Georgia? 
- We never had doubts that Georgia would not change its strategic direction and goals in respect of South Ossetia. They of course use all available leverages that to captivate RSO and place it under command by all means.

News_Titles: Condolences of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the death of Nelson Mandela
News_Shorts:
Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D. Sanakoev sent a telegram with condolences to the Minister of International Relations and Cooperation of Republic of South Africa Ms. Maite Nkoana-Mashabane in connection with the death of Nelson Mandela.
“Deeply regret about the death of His Excellency Mr. Nelson Mandela and would like to express our condolences to people of South Africa in connection with this loss.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Decision of the Government of Russian Federation on exclusion of South Ossetia from the list of hazardous countries for diplomats confirms again that situation in South Ossetia is stable and secure both for citizens of the Republic and for foreigners.
A big contribution to security and stability in the region is made by Russian military contingent that is fulfilling its mission on the bases of bilateral agreements.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
1st December 2013 is the 5th anniversary since the date of signing of the Decree on establishment and functioning of the Embassy of Republic of South Ossetia in Russian Federation.
Diplomatic service is not an easy thing to do. It always meant readiness to work hard for the sake of the country, urge for permanent self-improvement, implied analytical mentality and spacious scope, ability to make decisions in complex situations.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
On 26 November 2013 Republic of South Ossetia was visited by Co-chairmen of Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia. The delegation met in Tskhinval with participants of Geneva Discussions from South Ossetian side headed by Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution Murat Jioev.
During the meeting were discussed issues related to preparation of the next round of Geneva Discussions scheduled for 17-18 December 2013.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 15 November 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev received Head of the Office of the International Committee of Red Cross in South Ossetia Ms. Valentina Kim.
During the meeting the sides discussed issues related to Red Cross activities on the territory of Republic of South Ossetia during the last months. 
The recent tripartite meeting on those missing in action was also touched on. The sides had an opinion exchange on a range of issues of mutual interest. 
D. Sanakoev thanked the ICRC Head for the meeting and noted the longstanding fruitful work of the ICRC in South Ossetia. The meeting participants expressed their readiness for further coordinated activities and open cooperation. 
Tskhinval, 15 November 2013

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to Informational Agency ‘Res’
News_Shorts:
- What are the current priorities of the MFA’ work ?
- The main priority in our foreign-policy activities is insuring a well-deserved place for Republic of South Ossetia in the world. However, success in foreign-policy work is closely connected with dynamic development of the state itself, therefore we should make everything possible to improve the image Republic of South Ossetia and make it as attractive as possible for building up wider relations with other countries of the International Community.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 8 November 2013 a working visit of Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev took place to Italy. During the meeting the Minister carried out a range of meetings with representatives of political and civil organizations of the country, at the meetings were discussed issues of mutual interest.

News_Titles: Announcement of the South Ossetian delegation for mass-media
News_Shorts:
On 25th round of Geneva discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia

On 5-6 November 2013 another session in the frame of international discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia took place in Geneva. At the meeting participated delegations of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, United States, representatives of EU, OSCE, UN. South Ossetia delegation was headed by Plenipotentiary Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution Murat Jioev.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
On 14 October 2013 Head of Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie S. Sugaro met with the newly appointed Head of Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic in Republic of South Ossetia E. Kochiev. 
During the meeting S. Sugaro and E. Kochiev expressed their mutual interest in further development of cooperation between the Representations to improve their future work. 
In the end of the meeting E. Kochiev left a memorable record in the book of honored guests. 
 Tiraspol, 14 October 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
On 8 October 2013 Head of the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie S.V. Sugaro and his Deputy C. Yu. Myasnikov participated in the reception on the occasion of the 605th anniversary since foundation of Bendery city. The event was organized at Bendery city Administration.
At the event also participated Counselor of the Embassy of Russian Federation in Moldova Skotarenko V. P., Deputy Head of Russian Science and Culture Center in Republic of Moldova C.V. Davidenko, Head of Bendery city Administration Yu. V. Gervasyuk, deputies of City Council of Bendery, heads of the cities and regions of Pridnestrovie, representatives of civil society organizations and honored citizens of Bendery city.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Statements of NATO, US and European structures, made almost at the same time, express concerns about the border arrangement measures taken by authorities of South Ossetia along the state border line of South Ossetia and calls upon Russia to review recognition of independence of Abkhazia and South Ossetia are meant to meet expectations of Georgian society.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 2 October 2013 Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Alan Kochiev received Counselor of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in Republic of South Ossetia Marco Gil Casanova and First Secretary of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in Republic of South Ossetia Maria Gabriela Ruis.
During the meeting the sides had an opinion exchange on issues of further cooperation and development of bilateral ties. The sides confirmed their intention to extend cooperation and improvement of practical interaction between South Ossetia and Venezuela both in socio-economic and cultural spheres. 
Tskhinval, 2 October 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 1 October 2013 a working visit between Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of Abkhazia Vyacheslav Chikirba, in the frame of the official visit of the delegation of Republic of South Ossetia to Republic of Abkhazia, took place at the MFA of Republic of Abkhazia. At the meeting participated Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of Republic of South Ossetia in Republic of Abkhazia Oleg Botsiev and Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of Abkhazia Irakli Khintba.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
On September 2013 Head of Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie Sugaro S.V. participated in the reception organized on the occasion of the Independence Day and 20th Victory Day of Abkhazia. The reception that took place at the Representation of Republic of Abkhazia in Tiraspol.
Contribution of people of South Ossetia to Victory of Abkhazia was highly evaluated at the event and was reflected in the book of memories at the Representation. 
At the Representation was also shown a big photo exhibition and drawings of Pridnestrovian artists, who described beauty and life of the Abkhaz Republic.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
On the situation at border with Georgia 

During the recent days a provocative hysteria, generated by the Georgian leadership and their western partners, is observed in the area of state border of Republic of South Ossetia with Georgia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
