News_Shorts: South Ossetia was bewildered by the Statement of the MFA of Georgia and further declarations made by US Ambassador in Georgia Richard Norland and EU Commissioner for enlargement and European neighborhood policy Stepan Fule on arrangements carried out by the South Ossetian side along the state border between South Ossetia with Georgia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
A meeting between Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev with President of Italy-South Ossetia Friendship Society Professor Mauro Murgia took place at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia on 18 September 2013. At the meeting participated another member of the Italy-South Ossetia Friendship Society Mr.Giorgio Lorezi.
During the meeting were discussed questions of cooperation between South Ossetia and Italy-South Ossetia Friendship Society, was planed a concrete mechanism for further intensification of bilateral ties particularly in trade, economic and cultural spheres.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to State Television and Radio Broadcasting Company “IR”
News_Shorts:
On 17 September 2013 is marked the fifth anniversary of since signing of the Agreement on friendship, cooperation and bilateral support between Russian Federation and Republic of South Ossetia. The significance of this date was commented by the Minster of Foreign Affairs of RSO David Sanakoev to State Television and Radio Broadcasting Company “IR”.
- The Agreement on friendship, cooperation and bilateral support between Russian Federation and Republic of South Ossetia, signed on 17 September 2008, is very important for our nation. It laid a bases for establishment of bilateral relations between our states and created solid guarantees for security and stability for our nation. Agreement on friendship, cooperation and bilateral support between Russian Federation and republic of South Ossetia opened for South Ossetia possibilities for economic and social development.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affiars of Republic of SOuth Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 11 September 2013 a working meeting between delegation of South Ossetia to Geneva Discussions, headed by Plenipotentiary Presidential Envoy on post-conflict resolution Murat Kuzmich, and the Co-chairmen of Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia from EU, OSCE and UN took place in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia.
News_Shorts: Further to his working visit to Italy on 10 September 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev had a press-conference in Rome at a Conference Centre Roma Eventi. At the press-conference were present journalists from La Repubblica, Familia Cristiana, Eurasia, Itar-tass as well as representatives of the Russian Embassy in Italy.

News_Titles: Interview of the First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Kazbulat Tskhovrebov to State TV and Radio Company ‘IR’
News_Shorts:
On 9 September is five years since establishment of diplomatic relations between republic of South Ossetia and Russian Federation. The importance of this date was commented to STRC ‘IR’ by First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of RSO Kazbulat Tskhovrebov.
- Today we celebrate a historical date – establishment of diplomatic ties between Republic of South Ossetia and Russian Federation which is a logical consequence of another significant date, on 26 August 2008 Russian Federation recognized state independence of Republic of South Ossetia. On 20 January 2009 was signed a Memorandum of understanding between Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia and Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation on cooperation in foreign affairs, which foresees Russia to facilitate development of relations between Republic of South Ossetia and third states, its participation in activities of international organizations as well as readiness of the Russian side to represent interests of Republic of South Ossetia in third countries through diplomatic representations of Russian Federation

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 4 September Minster of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia left on a business trip to Italy where he carried out a range of meetings.
On 4 September the Minister had a meeting with Lara Ricchetti, SEL party delegate. During the meeting the deputy expressed her confidence that the first visit of the Minister to Italy would be successful and ties between South Ossetia and Italy would be extending and strengthening. 
On 5th September David Sanakoev was invited by Giuseppe Arzilli, owner of a private Gallery Arzilli, and participated in the opening ceremony of an exhibition called ‘Mountainous Abkhazia’ in Republic of San-Marino.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the meeting of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic South Ossetia D. G. Sanakoev with State Secretar, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia G. B. Karasin

On 2 September 2013 a meeting between Minster of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoev and State Secretary Deputy Minster of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation G. B. Karasin took place at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
On 26 August 2013 in Tiraspol, upon invitation of the Chairman of the Contribution Fund ‘Independent Eurasia’, under the patronage of the Council of Aldermen, Chairman of the Council of Aldermen G. S. Marakutsa, were carried out public expert hearings on: ‘Russia and Transdnestria: new phase of economic, social and humanitarian integration’, at the hearings participated Head of the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie S. Sugaro and his Deputy S. Myasnikov.
At the hearings spoke – Chairman of the Government of Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic Turanskaya T.M., Chairman of the Supreme Council Burla M.P, Deputy Chairman of the Government on social issues Nikiforova N.G., Director of ANGO ‘Eurasian Integration’ Argunov A. V.

News_Titles: Statement of the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
On the occasion of 5th anniversary since recognition of the independence of South Ossetia by Russian Federation

26 August is a historical date for people of South Ossetia. On this day five years ago President of Russia Dmitry Medvedev signed a Decree on recognition of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 26 August 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev had a meeting with the Deputy Chairman of the Government of Republic of Abkhazia Beslan Eshba and with Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of Abkhazia Oleg Arshba, they arrived to the Republic for celebrations of the 5th anniversary since recognition of the independence of the Republic of South Ossetia by Russian Federation. At the meeting participated Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Alan Kochiev.
During the meeting the sides congratulated each other with this remarkable day that is a critical benchmark in the recent history of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. Above that, during the meeting were discussed aspects of further development, interaction as well as issues of mutual cooperation. 
Tskhinval, 26 August 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 26 August 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev had a meeting with the Secretary General-Head of Secretariat of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Nagorny Karabakh Republic Semen Afiyan, who arrived to the Republic as a member of the NKR delegation for celebrations of the 5th anniversary since recognition of the independence of the Republic of South Ossetia by Russian Federation. At the meeting participated the Ombudsmen Inal Tasoev.
The sides discussed the current and future perspectives for development and further strengthening of the bilateral relations. 
Tskhinval, 26 August 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 26 August Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev received the President of Prodnestrovian Moldavian Republic Eugeny Shevchuk and Minister of Foreign Affairs of PMR Nina Shtansky, that are in Republic of South Ossetia with an official visit on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of since recognition of State Independence of South Ossetia.
At the meeting participated First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of RSO Kazbulat Tskhovrebov and Official Representative of Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic in Republic of South Ossetia Alexander Pukhaev.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the fifth anniversary since recognition of State Independence of South Ossetia by Russian Federation 

During decades Georgia was aiming to assert its rule over South Ossetia, using everything for suppression, including ethnic cleansing and direct genocide. Establishment of a sovereign State was the only way for people of South Ossetia to protect their right for life, freedom and human dignity under permanent threat of war from Georgia.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to newspaper South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the fifth anniversary since recognition of the independence of South Ossetia by Russian Federation
- 26 August is the fifth anniversary since recognition by Russia sovereignty of South Ossetia. In that sense 2013 is a special year for South Ossetia. What meaning has this strong-willed decision of Russia for people of South Ossetia?
- Indeed, 26 August will be the fifth anniversary since recognition the independence of South Ossetia by Russian Federation. On this day in 2008 President of Russian Federation Dmitry Medvedev made a life-changing decision for people of South Ossetia and Abkhazia – he signed a Decree on recognition of independence of Republic of South Ossetia and Abkhazia by Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 20 August 2013 the Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of Republic of South Ossetia in Republic of Abkhazia Mr. Oleg Botsiev handed in letters of credence to the President of Republic of Abkhazia Mr. Alexander Ankvab.
Alexander Ankvab congratulated Oleg Botsiev with his appointment and wished him success in his service. Oleg Botsiev assured to make every effort to strengthen relations between people of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. 
Tskhinval, 20 August 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 16 August 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs David Sanakoev met with students of Moscow State Institute of International Relations sent for studies from South Ossetia.
David Sanakoev congratulated the students with successful hand over of the exams and thanked them for their good learning performance. The students shared their impressions about the University, told about themselves, their hobbies, problems and plans for future. 
The Minister hoped that after graduating from such University they will return to their Motherland and will make every effort to further strengthen positive image of the young independent Republic at the International arena.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 10 August 2013 police vehicle of the MIA crossed State border of the RSO from territory bordering with Georgia in village Artsev, Tskhinval region. The vehicle ignored numerous requests to leave territory of South Ossetia. Border guards of the RSO KGB border service had to make a warning shot into the air, only after that the trespassers returned to territory of Georgia. The incident was observed by EU Mission monitors.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts: On 9 August 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia had a meeting with a delegation from Italy headed by the President of Italy-South Ossetia Friendship Society, Professor Mauro Murgia. The meeting was carried out at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
Commemoration of the fifth anniversary of Georgian aggression against Republic of South Ossetia took place at the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie during the night of 8 August 2013. Head of the RSO Representation in Pridnestrovie Sergey Sugaro, his colleagues and residents of Tiraspol gathered together, despite the late hour, to remember peaceful residents and defenders of Tskhinval who passed away in August 2008 .
The Head of the Official Representation of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovie Sergey Sugaro had a speech in front of those who gathered. He noted that the Pridnestrvians were strongly supporting their South Ossetian brothers from the first days of the war, were actively braking the informational blockade, appealing to the International Community to stop the bloodshed.
Volunteers from PMR participated in rehabilitation works of destroyed Tskhinval. The volunteers arrived to Tskhinval as part of the rescue brigade.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 7-8 August 2013 Republic of South Ossetia commemorated fifth anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
In connection with the fifth anniversary of the aggression of Georgia against RSO

South Ossetia is existing as an independent states during 22 years. During this period people of South Ossetia suffered three bloody wars unleashed by Georgia. Georgian bandits and regular forces wiped off the earth tens of Ossetian villages, carried out acts of genocide not only in South Ossetia but also on the territory of Georgia.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to Informational Agency ‘Res’
News_Shorts:
-On 8 August South Ossetia will commemorate the fifth anniversary since the Georgian aggression. Looking back at those days, can you say that the war could have been avoided?
- On 8 August Georgia again penetrated into the territory of South Ossetia. This penetration was the most bloody and destructive in our recent history. I am categorically against the statement that these days we commemorate five years since Georgian aggression. Recent history of Georgian aggression started in 1989. We should not forget about it. This is when ‘Georgia for Georgians’ policy started to be implemented and is being implemented until now despite the repeated changes in the Georgian leadership. This is when started struggle for independence. For independence from Georgia first of all. We do not have a right to forget how they have shot down refugees at Zar road, buried people alive in Georgian village Eredvi, tortured people.…

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Official Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic
News_Shorts:
1 August 2013 is a morning day in Tiraspol on those defenders that fallen for the Republic and victims of armed conflict on Dnester.
At the Glory Memorial was organized traditional meeting-requiem and laying of wreaths. At the meeting participated Chairman and members of the Government., Chairman and delegates of the Supreme Counsel, representatives of the Presidential Administration, Heads of Ministries and departments, representatives of pubic and patriotic organizations.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 30th July Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Mr. David Sanakoev had a meeting with Ms. Valentina Kim, Head of the International Committee of Red Cross Tskhinval Office.
During the meeting we discussed ICRC operations in South Ossetia, in particular Ms. Kim informed the Minister about the recent ICRC activities. The meeting participants exchanged their opinions about a range of issues that were of mutual interest.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Georgia and its western sponsors do not leave their hopes to implement a project ‘involvement without recognition’ in South Ossetia and Abkhazia aimed to dissolve their independence. In his speech at a conference in Batumi on relations between Georgia and European Union, Representative from the European External Action Service, Mr. Gunnar Weigand suggested extension of the agreement, that is being signed, on association and free trade between Brussels and Tbilisi, on South Ossetia and Abkhazia.

News_Titles: Announcement of South Ossetia delegation for mass media
News_Shorts:
On 24th round of Geneva International Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia

On 25-26 June 2013 another meeting in the frame International Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia took place in Geneva. At the meeting participated delegations of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, USA as well as representatives of EU, UN and OSCE. South Ossetia delegation was headed by the Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution Mr. Murat Dzhioev.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 27 June 2013 a special edition of newspaper ‘Vestnik of South Ossetia’ is published by the Plenipotentiary Representation (Embassy) of Republic of South Ossetia in Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic. This edition is published as an attachment to PMR republican newspaper ‘Pridnestrovie’ from February 2009 on a quarterly bases.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the resolution adopted at the 67th plenary session of the UN General Assembly 

On 13 June 2013 resolution of Georgia on refugees and temporary displaced people from Abkhazia and South Ossetia was adopted. Similar resolutions were adopted by the UN General Assembly for five years in a row, all of them are of nonbinding character.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On submitted by Georgia draft resolution on the status of displaced persons from Abkhazia and South Ossetia to United Nations General Assembly

Since 2009, the Government of Georgia had annually submitted to UN General Assembly its draft resolutions concerning displaced persons and refugees from Abhazia and South Ossetia. This year that annual resolution also is to be submitted to 67th plenary session of the UN General Assembly.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On demarcation works on the border with Georgia 

The recent loud and nervous campaign in Georgia on demarcation and defining the state border line of the Republic of South Ossetia is another false provocation aimed at misinforming of the population and at gaining support of the International Community in achieving its aims.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 6 June 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia D. G. Sanakoev had a meeting with the new Head of the Office of the International Committee of the Red Cross Ms. Valentina Kim.
During the meeting were discussed new aspects of cooperation, including issues of humanitarian and legal character, where the Minister expressed his hopes for further fruitful cooperation with the ICRC.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On reception of a delegation from Friendship Society Italy - South Ossetia 


On 1-3 June 2013 South Ossetia was visited by a delegation from Italy headed by the President of Friendship Society between Italy and South Ossetia, Professor Mauro Murjia. The delegation was invited to South Ossetia by the Minister of Foreign Affairs of RSO D.G. Sanakoev.
In Tskhinval the delegation was received by the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs A. Kochiev. While greeting the guests he noted that South Ossetia continued to extend its international ties and was making new friends. Policy of Georgia, directed at isolation of South Ossetia and Abkhazia, was doomed to failure. Nobody in the world doubted that it was Georgia who started the war in 2008 and that a consistent work has been done to achieve further recognition of our state.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the statement of the MFA of Georgia

On 28 May 2013 MFA of Georgia expressed its strong feelings in respect of the so called self-willed shift of the border of South Ossetia by Russian military and erection of barbed wire in the vicinity of villages Ditsi and Dvani.

News_Titles: Interview of the First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Mr. Kazbulat Tskhovrebov to newspaper ‘South Ossetia’
News_Shorts:
- It’s been five years since recognition of the independence of Republic of South Ossetia by Russian Federation. What in your opinion is the main policy of the MFA of RSO in a recognized state? 
- The main activities of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs are aimed at elaboration of a general strategy of foreign policy of the Republic of South Ossetia and its implementation, defined by RSO President. These tasks are entrusted to the MFA in accordance with the Statute ‘On the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia’, Decree of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia ‘On coordination by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia in carrying out integrated foreign policy of Republic of South Ossetia’ dated 27 April 2005.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 20 May, 2013 Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Georgia David Zalkaliani stated at the briefing: “One of the main aims of all the visits that are carried out by MFA and Government of Georgia is non-recognition and we never stopped our efforts in this direction”.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia.
News_Shorts:
On 20 May 2013 South Ossetia commemorated victims of Georgian aggression on Zar road in 1992.
On 20 May 1992 on the Road of Life, connecting Tskhinval with the rest of the world, near village Zar a convoy with defenseless children, elders and women was shot dead. 33 people were killed, 16 people were wounded. The eldest among them was 73 years old, the youngest was 11 years.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 17 May 2013 a working meeting between members of South-Ossetian delegation for Geneva Discussions, headed by the Presidential Envoy on post-conflict resolution Mr. Murat Dzhioev, and Co-chairs of Geneva Discussions on Seecurity and Stability from EU, OSCE and UN took place.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 16 May 2013 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Mr. David Sanakoev arrived with an official visit to Sukhum, where he participated in celebrations related to 20th anniversary since establishment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Abkhazia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the speech made at PACE spring session by Prime-Minister of Georgia

On 23 April 2013 Prime-Minister of Georgia Bidzina Ivanishvili made a speech at the session of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe in Strasburg and announced the main directions and tasks in foreign policy of Georgia. He particularly said “it is known that 20 percent of the territory of Georgia was occupied by Russia in 2008”.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia.
News_Shorts:
On 24 April 2013 during a working visit to Moscow Minister of Foreign Affairs of South Ossetia David Sanakoev met with Secretary of State, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation G. B. Karasin.
During the meeting were discussed topical issues in the context of bilateral relations between Russian Federation and Republic of South Ossetia, interaction in foreign-policy as well as some aspects of the current situation in South Caucasus.
Tskhinval, 25 April 2013

News_Titles: Commentary of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Mr. David Sanakoev to Information Agency ‘Res’.
News_Shorts: On possibilities provided to citizens of South Ossetia for studying at diplomatic institutions of higher education

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On appointment of Mr. Oleg Botsiev as an Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Republic of Abkhazia. 

On 15 April 2013 by a Decree of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia L. Tibilov Botsiev Oleg Ilich was appointed as the Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Republic of Abkhazia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On possible recurring investigation of occurrences that took place in August 2008 in Georgia 

Requests to carry a recurring investigation on the facts that took place during war in August 2008 and their legal qualification are heard more often from highest Georgian tribunes. In particular, Prime-Minister of Georgia Bidzina Ivanishvili stated that “the war issue is covered with mist” and called on investigation of it’s circumstances.

News_Titles: Announcement of the South-Ossetian delegation on the 23-rd round of Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia.
News_Shorts: On 26-27 March 2013 a regular meeting in the framework of the International Geneva Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia took place. At the meeting participated delegations of Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, US as well as representatives of EU, UN and OSCE. The South-Ossetian delegation was headed by the Plenipotentiary Presidential Envoy on post conflict resolution M. Dzioev.

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 5 March 2013 First Deputy of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia Mr. Kazbulat Tskhovrebov received the Head of Tskhinval office of the International Committee of Red Cross Ms. Leanna Hutchins.
During the meeting Ms. Hutchins briefed about ICRC activities in South Ossetia during the recent months. The meeting participants also discussed a range of practical issues of humanitarian character. 
The sides expressed their readiness for further cooperation. 
Tskhinval, 5 March 2013

News_Titles: Announcement of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 13 March 2012 Republic of South Ossetia was visited by delegation of the Co-chairs of the Geneva International Discussions on Security in Transcaucasia. The delegation was received by the representatives of the authorities of the Republic of South Ossetia headed by the Plenipotentiary Representative of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post conflict resolution Mr. M. Dzhioev.

News_Titles: Information of the press-service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 21 February 2012, during the working visit to Moscow, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D. Sanakoev met with the Secretary of State – Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russian Federation G. Karasin. Plenipotentiary Representative of the President of RSO M. Dzhioev was also present at the meeting.

News_Titles: Announcement of the delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia at Geneva discussions
News_Shorts:
On 22-nd round of Geneva International Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia
On 12 December 2012 another meeting in the frame of International Discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia took place.
At the meeting participated delegations from Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, USA as well as representatives of EU, UN and OSCE. The South Ossetian delegation was headed by the Plenipotentiary Envoy of the President of South Ossetia on post conflict resolution Mr. Murat Dzhioev.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On appointment of Tibilov Daniel as an Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela. 


On 21 December 2012 Tibilov Daniel Izrailovich was appointed as an Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela by Presidential Decree dated 21 December 2012.
Biodata:

News_Titles: Report of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of RSO for 2012
News_Shorts: In 2012 Ministry of Foreign Affairs continued its activities in accordance with the Constitution of the Republic of South Ossetia, legislation and regulatory framework of the Republic. The main directions of the Ministry’s activities were as earlier determined by the development strategy of the Republic, defined by the President of the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Mr. David Sanakoev to newspaper ‘South Ossetia’.
News_Shorts: - How do you evaluate last year’s results in terms of development and strengthening foreign policy of South Ossetia?

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Mr. David Sanakoev to newspaper ‘South Ossetia’.
News_Shorts: - How do you evaluate last year’s results in terms of development and strengthening foreign policy of South Ossetia?

News_Titles: Comments of the Minister of Foreign Affairs Mr. David Sanakoev
News_Shorts:
In respect of the speech of M. Saakashvili at winter session of PACE

The speech of the President Saakashvili was at the session of Parliamentary Assembly was of course tendentious and biased to South Ossetia and Russian Federation. We have not heard anything new from the president of Georgia. He had the same rhetorics as before, which is also followed by the Government of Georgia for many years and the culmination of which was the military aggression in August 2008.

News_Titles: Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 22 January Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia received the Head of Tskhinval Office of the International Committee of Red Crossof Ms. Leanna Hutchins.
During the meeting were discussed activities of ICRC, in particular, projects planed by the organization for 2013.
The Head of MFA had positively appraised the work of ICRC for the last year and wished for further fruitful cooperation. 
Tskhinval, 22 January 2013

News_Titles: Comments of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the report made by Swedish parliamentarian Ms. Tina Acketoft

On 21 January 2013 winter session of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) was opened. On 23 January Swedish parliamentarian Ms. Tina Aketoft made a report “Georgia and Russia: humanitarian situation in the conflict and war affected areas”.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the resolution adopted by PACE, based on the report of Ms. Tina Acketoft

On 23 January at the winter session of PACE a final resolution was adopted. The resolution was based on the report of Tina Aketoft “Georgia and Russia: humanitarian situation in the conflict and war affected areas”. The resolution raises a number of serious questions in South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The Announcement of Press Service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
The Statement of the Press service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On August 8, 2012 on the initiative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs a round table "Iron Nykhas" was held in Tskhinval. Representatives of the Ossetian communities in Belgium, the Netherlands, the regions of the Russian Federation, Syria, Turkey, France, representatives of South Ossetia public organizations and well-known representatives of Ossetian science attended the discussions. The events of August 2008 in retrospect of the Ossetian-Georgian interrelations were discussed at the round table.

News_Titles: The commentary of RSO Foreign Minister
News_Shorts:
In connection with the Decree of RSO President of Consular agency establishment

In connection with necessity to improve the grade of consular services for the citizens of the Republic of South Ossetia at the territory of Russian Federation by Decree of RSO President Leonid Tibilov was established a Consular agency of the Republic of South Ossetia in Vladikavkaz.

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On November 28, 2012 the Embassy of the Republic of South Ossetia in Russian Federation played host for the meeting of Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev with students of RF MFA Diplomatic Academy, MSIIR (University) students and students of International relations of RGSU faculty, sent from South Ossetia for teaching. 
The meeting was participated by Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in RF D. N. Medoev and Ambassy staff.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the fourth anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Tonight, on August 7 at 10 pm, commemorative events devoted to the fourth anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia will start in the Republic of South Ossetia with the action "Exhibition of shot paintings," which will be held at the Theater Square in the center of Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On a telephone conversation between Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G.Sanakoyev and State Secretary, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Grigory Karasin.
A telephone conversation between Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G.Sanakoyev and State Secretary, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia Grigory Karasin took place on August 8.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Twenty-three years ago, November 23, 1989 a march of tens of thousands of Georgian extremists, organized by leaders of nationalist movements, with the complicity of the authorities of Georgia was stopped on the outskirts of Tskhinval. The march to Tskhinval was aimed at intimidating of Ossetians and it was to be followed by their expulsion from the territory of South Ossetia. Georgian nationalists plan was thwarted then, however, those November days were a prologue to the long struggle of the people of South Ossetia for the right to life, liberty, and human dignity.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: August 8, 2012 a round table "Iron Nykhas" with the participation of the representatives of the Ossetian diaspora and foreign countries took place in Tskhinval. It was organized on the initiative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in the frames of the commemorative events devoted to the fourth anniversary of the August 2008 armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia, in which hundreds of people, including Russian peacekeepers stationed in South Ossetia under an international mandate were killed.

News_Titles: The Announcement of Press Service of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On November 20 co-chairs of the Geneva discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia paid a working visit to the Republic of South Ossetia. The delegation was received by the representatives of the Republic of South Ossetia authorities, led by the Plenipotentiary Representative of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on post-conflict settlement M.K. Jioyev, in Tskhinval.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: In connection with the fourth anniversary of the recognition of the independence of South Ossetia by the Russian Federation

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On September 18 the Delegation of the Co-Chairmen of the Geneva international discussions on security in Transcaucasia paid a working visit to the Republic of South Ossetia.
The sides discussed issues related to the preparation of the next 21round of the Geneva discussions which will be held in October of 2012.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the situation at the border with Georgia
News_Shorts: Four years after the August 2008 armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia the situation in the region is complex and characterized by the Georgian leadership intention to carry out large-scale provocations. Despite the impact of August 2008 Georgian authorities leave no revanchist sentiments.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
relatively Saakashvili `s speech at 67th session of the UN General Assembly
On September 25, 2012, Georgian President Mikhail Saakashvili in his speech at the 67th session of the UN GA accused Russia "of an attempt to influence political processes in Georgia by particular means of large-scale maneuvers and troop concentrations on the border" with supposedly occupied regions of Georgia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
on the meeting of Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoyev with Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation Sergey Lavrov 
On October 9, 2012 Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoyev had a meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov as a part of his first official visit to the Russian Federation.

News_Titles: Statement of the Republic of South Ossetia Delegation in the Geneva Discussions
News_Shorts:
on the twenty-first round of the Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability Issues in Transcaucasia.
 On 10-11 October 2012 the twenty-first meeting in the frames of international discussions on security and stability in the Caucasus was held in Geneva. It was attended by the delegations from the Republic of South Ossetia, the Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, the Russian Federation, the United States, as well as by the representatives from the EU, the UN and the OSCE. South Ossetian delegation was headed by M.K. Jioyev - Presidential Plenipotentiary Envoy for post-conflict settlement.

News_Titles: Statement of the Republic of South Ossetia Delegation in the Geneva Discussions
News_Shorts:
on the twenty-first round of the Geneva Discussions on Security and Stability Issues in Transcaucasia.
 On 10-11 October 2012 the twenty-first meeting in the frames of international discussions on security and stability in the Caucasus was held in Geneva. It was attended by the delegations from the Republic of South Ossetia, the Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, the Russian Federation, the United States, as well as by the representatives from the EU, the UN and the OSCE. South Ossetian delegation was headed by M.K. Jioyev - Presidential Plenipotentiary Envoy for post-conflict settlement.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
in connection with an armed provocation of Georgia in the territory South Ossetia
On September 29, 2012, at 3:40 am, South Ossetia border post in the village of Karzman, Java region, was gunned with automatic firearms and grenade launchers. South Ossetian side did not open return fire, but in the course of search operations in the territory of the Republic of South Ossetia, Georgian Interior Ministry official was arrested near the state border and he was seized a NATO-standard automatic rifle with grenade launcher.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of foreign affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: From August 31 to September 3, the official delegation of the Republic of South Ossetia led by the Chairman of the Parliament of South Ossetia Kochieva S.Y. visited the Transdniestria Moldavian Republic, which was celebrating the 22nd anniversary of the proclamation of independence. The delegation also included Deputy Foreign Minister of South Ossetia Tskhovrebov K.I. and the Head of Translation Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of South Ossetia Tadtaev S.Y.

News_Titles: Commentary of South Ossetia Foreign Minister D.G. Sanakoyev
News_Shorts: The media continues to discuss the article from the newspaper "Izvestia" published on 14 August 2012. It reported that allegedly to the order of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia L.Kh. Tibilov "several Georgian villages located to the north of the capital of the Republic will be taken down” in South Ossetia. Current and former Georgian politicians are concerned about this article as well as some representatives of international organizations, including the OSCE High Commissioner on National Minorities, Mr. Vollebaek.

News_Titles: Comments of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the statement adopted at the NATO summit in Chicago
News_Shorts: In a statement issued after the NATO Summit in Chicago on May 21, 2012, the member states of NATO, supporting Georgia's aspirations to join NATO called on Russia "to deny its recognition of the Georgian regions South Ossetia and Abkhazia as independent states and to reduce the Russian military presence in these regions."

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with Hillary Clinton's statement at a press briefing in Batumi
News_Shorts: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia is deeply concerned about Hillary Clinton statement made on June 5 at a briefing in Batumi on the "recognition of so-called neutral passports for the residents of South Ossetia and Abkhazia."

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
August 15-17, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in the Republic of South Ossetia Hugo Jose Garcia Hernandez paid a working visit to South Ossetia.
During the visit, Ambassador Hernandez was received by the President of the Republic of South Ossetia L.Kh. Tibilov. He also had a talk to the Minister of Foreign Affairs D.G. Sanakoyev.

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
An Embassy of the Republic of South Ossetia in Russian Federation in Moscow today played host for the meeting of the first deputy Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia Kazbulat Tskhovrebov with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Nauru Kieren Keke who is in Moscow with working visit.
The Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Russian Federation Dmitry Medoev has also taken part in the meeting.

News_Titles: Interview of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia David Sanakoev to the information agency «Res»
News_Shorts: Question: The world media margins keep discussing the situation in Syria and its further development. What is the stand of South Ossetia on this issue?

News_Titles: Decree of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on assignment of Sanakoev D.G. of diplomatic rank of the Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador.
News_Shorts:
To assign diplomatic rank of Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador to Sanakoev David Georgievich – Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia. 
President of the Republic of South Ossetia
L. Tibilov
Tskhinval
July 18, 2012

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the developments in Syria
News_Shorts: Expanding in Syria crisis causes more and more concern in South Ossetia. Coming from this state news are witnessing of another armed incidents, bloody terrorist acts in Damascus and numerous victims among the peaceful population. Today Syria faces difficult times and first of all due to the so called foreign well-wishers who from the one hand proclaims democracy and from the other arms nailers thus pushing opposing sides to further fierce and irreconcilable confrontation.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the Georgia MFA statement
News_Shorts: In the statement of Georgia MFA disclosed on July 16, 2012 was expressed concern apropos of the visit of Land Forces Commander-in-Chief Colonel General Vladimir Chirkin to South Ossetia who ostensibly “in violation of Georgia’s state border visited occupied by Russia Georgian regions Tskhinval region and Abkhazia”.

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On July 14, 2012 in the capital of South Ossetia are under way the memorable events dedicated to the Peacekeeper’s Day. 20 years ago sharp on the bases of Agreement of main principles of Georgian-Ossetian conflict settlement signed by Heads of Russia, Georgia, North and South Ossetia on June 24, 1992 in the town of Sochi, in georgian-ossetian conflict zone entered tripotide peacekeeping forces. They become a buffer between conflicting sides.

News_Titles: Interview with Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, David Sanakoyev to news agency "Res"
News_Shorts:
- How do you assess the activities of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs prior to your appointment? Which areas in the department you wish to strengthen and what measures you are going to do about it?
-The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has done a great job over the years. I think that all necessary actions have been carried out at each stage by the Foreign Ministry.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: July 6, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.Sanakoev was in the Republic of Abkhazia on a working visit during which he met Foreign Minister V.Chirikba.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly Adoption of Resolution on Georgia
News_Shorts: On July 9, 2012 at the annual meeting of the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly in Monaco the Resolution "On the situation in Georgia" proposed by the Polish deputy Michal Scherba was supported. South Ossetia and Abkhazia are referred to as the "occupied territories" in the resolution.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the Adoption of UN General Assembly Resolution on Refugees
News_Shorts: On July 3, 2012 the UN General Assembly approved a draft resolution on "Situation of Internally Displaced Persons and Refugees from Abkhazia, Georgia and Tskhinvali district / South Ossetia, Georgia" submitted by Georgia for balloting.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in Connection with the Transfer of the Georgian Police Post in the Village Zardiantkari
News_Shorts: On June 29, 2012 the Interior Ministry of Georgia relocated a police station a few hundred meters closer to the state border of South Ossetia in the village Zardiantkari (Georgia), which is located opposite the South Ossetian village of Khelchua. This caused great tension among the people of Ossetian nationality living in these villages.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the meeting of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoyev with State Secretary – Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia G.B.Karasin
News_Shorts:
On June 25, 2012 a meeting of the of the Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia D.G. Sanakoyev with State Secretary – Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation G.B. Karasin was held in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation.
In the course of the conversation the sides discussed topical issues of further expansion of the cooperation in the main fields of foreign policy, economic and cultural cooperation; and indicated the significance of the Geneva discussions on issues of security and stability in the Transcaucasia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Last Thursday, June 21, 2012 XVII International Economic Forum started in St. Petersburg; it will last for three days. The event is attended by several thousand people, including a delegation from the Republic of South Ossetia consisting of the Minister of Foreign Affairs D.G. Sanakoyev, Acting Minister of Economic Development A. V. Khabalova and the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Russian Federation
D. N. Medoyev.

News_Titles: Joint statement of the Republic of Abkhazia and Republic of South Ossetia representatives on the issues of security and stability in Northern Caucasus
News_Shorts:
Of wrongfulness of using “occupation” and “occupied territories” terms in respect of South Ossetia and Abkhazia
Representatives of the Republic of Abkhazia and Republic of South Ossetia notes eventuated within the frameworks of 20th round of Geneva discussions on the questions of security and stability in Northern Caucasus discussion of illegality of using in respect of South Ossetia and Abkhazia “occupation” and “occupied territories” terms from the point of view of norms and principles of international law as well.

News_Titles: Comment of the Ministry of Foreign affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the Upcoming NATO Summit in Chicago
News_Shorts: It is known that on May 20-21, 2012 the next summit of the North Atlantic Alliance will take place in Chicago. Georgia has great expectations for the forthcoming summit. The Georgian leadership hopes that the Alliance countries will designate Georgia as one of the ‘advanced countries for membership in NATO’ at the NATO Summit in Chicago. Georgia`s representatives surely love to sew on all sorts of attractive labels on their country, and it does not upset anyone in South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Connection with the Georgia Reaction on the Proposals of the Russian Side
News_Shorts: As the events reveal, the Statement of Georgian President Mikhail Saakashvili, on the abolition of entry visas to Georgia for the citizens of the Russian Federation made in his annual address to Parliament on February 27, 2012 is another propaganda ploy aimed not only at increasing the flow of Russian citizens in Georgia, but rather at the suggestion of an international myth of the "constructiveness" and "peacefulness" of foreign policy actions of the author of this idea.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia on the Report of PACE on Presidential Elections in Russia
News_Shorts: April 23, the Report on 2012 Presidential elections in Russia held on March 4 made by the observers of the Council of Europe was heard at the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe. This document, being initially biased, disapproves the opening of polling stations in the territories of the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Abkhazia which allegedly are ‘occupied territories of Georgia’.

News_Titles: Commentary of Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On the 16th of April 2012 Minister of Foreign Affairs of Republic of South Ossetia received the Head of Tskhinval office of ICRC Pierre Reichel .
Mr. Pierre Reichel which ends his activity as the head of Head of Tskhinval office of ICRC represented to the Minister his successor Ms. Leanna Hutchins. 
During the visit there were discussed issues of ICRC activity on territory of Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Republic of South Ossetia Foreign Ministry representative concerning the reaction of number of states on presidential elections in South Ossetia
News_Shorts: As it was earlier informed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, on the 8th of April 2012 the people of South Ossetia elected the President of state in full accordance with the Constitution of Republic and election legislation. However, some countries, particularly Azerbaijan, Georgia and US made statements of considering Presidential elections in South Ossetia “illegal”.

News_Titles: Comments of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning Saakashvili's Statement in the Summit in Seoul
News_Shorts:
On March 27 President Mikhail Saakashvili, speaking at the plenary session of the Summit on Nuclear Safety in Seoul called South Ossetia and Abkhazia ‘black holes’ not only for the narcotics trade, but also for the smuggling of nuclear materials. 
Today, when another round of discussions on security and stability in the Caucasus starts in Geneva, these statements are quite expected. Saakashvili and other Georgian leaders cannot do without mentioning of the "sick theme" of South Ossetia and Abkhazia in all their speeches. Summit in Seoul was no exception.

News_Titles: The announcement of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts: On 25 March 2012 another elections of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia were held in the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry of Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts: On 12th March, 2012 the Georgian Deputy Foreign Minister Nino Kalandadze, speaking at a weekly press briefing, commented on the report of the U.S. Department of State Strategy for Drug Control. As Georgian politicians usually do Mrs. Kalandadze with the zeal of staff ill-wisher tried to turn the position of the report, which expressed concern about the level of drug crime in Georgia, against South Ossetia and Abkhazia, accusing them of drug trafficking.

News_Titles: The Statement of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry of Foreign Affairs about the Statement of PACE co-reporters
News_Shorts: On 12 March, 2012 the Statement of co-reporters Kastriot Islami (Albania) and Astrup Jensen (Denmark) of the Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe (PACE) in Georgia was released in Strasburg.

News_Titles: The Republic of South Ossetia Ministry of Foreign Affairs Press Service Announcement
News_Shorts:
The Republic of South Ossetia Minister of Foreign Affairs M.K. Jioev took part in the work of the round table devoted to the presidential elections in the RSO. 
In the course of the meeting they discussed topical issues connected with the forthcoming elections planned on March 25, 2012. 
The representatives of the Central Election Committee, Ministry of Defense, the Parliament of the Republic of South Ossetia, candidates for the Presidency, political scientists were invited to the round table. 
Tskhinval, 6 March, 2012

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in Connection with Election of the President of the Russian Federation, passed in the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 4 March 2012, the citizens of the Russian Federation, permanent residents of the Republic of South Ossetia or those staying on the ballot day on its territory, took part in the elections of the President of Russian Federation. 
Twelve polling stations were opened in South Ossetia. The elections were organized by the Embassy of the Russian Federation in the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 1 March, 2012 the Republic of South Ossetia Minister of Foreign Affairs M.K. Dzhioev received the Head of the Official Representative of Trans-Dniester Moldova Republic in the Republic of South Ossetia A.I. Pukhaev.

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the Referendum on the Project of New Constitution in Syria
News_Shorts:
On 26 February 2012, a Referendum on the new draft Constitution of the Syrian Arab Republic was held in Syria. 7, 5 million citizens or 89, 4 % of those who took part in the Referendum on Sunday supported the new Constitution. 
The results of the referendum showed that the people of Syria support the policy of the government oriented on the reforms which will contribute to the expansion of civil rights and liberties and building a modern democratic state.

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 22 February, 2012 the Republic of South Ossetia Minister of Foreign Affairs M.K. Dzhioev received the Republic of Abkhazia Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary in the Republic of South Ossetia Nodar Pliyev. 
In the course of the conversation in which the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Kazbulat Tskhovrebov took place, a range of the issues connected with the development of South-Ossetia- Abkhazia relationships was discussed. Both sides underlined their intentions to further widening of the effective cooperation.

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 17 February, 2012, co-chairmen of Geneva talks on Security in Transcaucasia paid a working visit to the Republic of South Ossetia. The delegation was met by South Ossetia participants of Geneva talks. 
In the course of the meeting they discussed questions related to the preparation of the 19th round of Geneva talks which is planned to take place on 28-29 March, 2012. South – Ossetia participants underlined their readiness to constructive work at the forthcoming round of Geneva talks.

News_Titles: The Announcement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 17 February, 2012 the Republic of South Ossetia Minister of Foreign Affairs M.K. Dzhioev received the Head of the Official Representative of Trans-Dniester Moldova Republic in the Republic of South Ossetia A.I. Pukhaev.

News_Titles: The answer of the South Ossetia Minister for Foreign Affairs Murat Dzhioev to the question of information agency ‘Res’
News_Shorts: Georgian mass media has started again to bring up the question of delivering of so-called neutral passports to the residents of South Ossetia and Abkhazia by Georgian authorities these days. It has been reported about extremely negative reaction of Abkhazian authorities to the attempts of some international organizations working in Abkhazia to distribute these passports among the residents of Abkhazia. The reporter of ‘RES’ Agency asked the Republic of South Ossetia Minister for Foreign Affairs Murat Jioev to comment the problem of ‘neutral’ passports.

News_Titles: Commentary of press- service of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry for Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
regarding N. Kalandadze statement about the ‘territorial integrity of Georgia’ 
On January 26, 2012, the Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs of Georgia Nino Kalandadze in her interview to TV broadcaster ‘Rustavy’ announced that ‘no authority of Georgia, no matter who is in power of the country, will concede independence and territorial integrity of the country’.

News_Titles: Commentary of the official representative of the Republic of South Ossetia Ministry for Foreign Affairs
News_Shorts:
regarding D. Jalaganiya statement about the events in South Ossetia 
On January 30, 2012 the Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs of Georgia David Jalaganiya declared at the briefing that ‘official Tbilisi will not be able to interfere in the events of South Ossetia directly’ meaning the presidential elections in the Republic of South Ossetia. Further he refined that ‘we shall keep on trying to influence the events through existing international mechanisms ’.

News_Titles: Information of the press bureau of the Republic of South Ossetia’s Foreign Ministry in connection with the MSF delegation visit
News_Shorts: On 7-10 of February 2012 the Republic of South Ossetia played host for the delegation of Moscow affiliated branch of the International medical humanitarian organization “Doctors Without Boundaries”, headed by Vladimir Neiman. Purpose of the visit – study of interaction possibilities and implementation of programs in South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the press bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
pertaining the summit of US and Georgia presidents
According to information received, during the eventuated meeting of US and Georgia presidents was discussed not only the “model of democracy and transparency” of Georgia but the issue of American arms delivery to Georgia renewing, suspended after the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia in August 2008.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning the statement of G. Vashadze at PAEC winter session
News_Shorts:
On 25 of January 2012 at PAEC winter session in Strasbourg made a speech Georgia’s Foreign Minister G. Vashadze. More than hour he expounded his vision of situation around Abkhazia and South Ossetia to PAEC members. 
Georgian authorities one more time used high international platform to bring to international community again convenient for themselves information and accuse South Ossetia, Abkhazia and Russia.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Republic of South Ossetia Minister for Foreign Affairs Murat Dzhioev to news agency «Res»
News_Shorts:
on the statement of President of Georgia`s Press-Speaker Manana Mandjgaladze 
President of Georgia`s Press-Speaker Manana Mandjgaladze announced that restoration of diplomatic ties between Georgia and Russia would only take place after closing of ‘embassies illegally opened’ in South Ossetia and Abkhazia. The reporter of News Agency ‘PEC’ asked Minister for Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Murat Dzhioev to give comments on this statement.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the Republic of South Ossetia’s independence referendum anniversary
News_Shorts: On January 19, 2012 is celebrated a twentieth anniversary since holding of referendum of independence of the Republic of South Ossetia and its reunification with Russia. Twenty years ago southossetian people fulfilled a significant political step in formation of its statehood. At the nation-wide voting conducted in full accordance with international norms and in presence of international observers from former USSR it uphold its right for creation of the independent state and a choice of strategic course and partners.

News_Titles: Commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning the adopted by Georgia’s Parliament “Concept of national safety”
News_Shorts: On December 23, 2011 the Parliament of Georgia adopted new Concept of national safety. Elaborating and fulfilling of any concepts of development, no doubt, is a sovereign right of any state. But in this case Georgian document is another disguised propaganda maneuver, meant first of all for confirming of interests of western patrons of Georgian authorities.

News_Titles: Комментарий Министерства иностранных дел Республики Южная Осетия относительно принятой парламентом Грузии «Концепции национальной безопасности»
News_Shorts: On December 23, 2011 the Parliament of Georgia adopted new Concept of national safety. Elaborating and fulfilling of any concepts of development, no doubt, is a sovereign right of any state. But in this case Georgian document is another disguised propaganda maneuver, meant first of all for confirming of interests of western patrons of Georgian authorities.

News_Titles: The commentary of the Ministry of foreighn affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Concerning the US Senate project of arms supply renewing to Georgia

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia, сoncerning the eighteenth meeting within the framework of international discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia
News_Shorts: On December 14, 2011 ended eighteenth round of Geneva international discussions on security and stability in Transcaucasia. Delegations of the Republic of South Ossetia, Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia, Russian Federation, US, as well as EU, UN and OSCE representatives participated the meeting. South Ossetian delegation was headed by plenipotentiary representative of the President Boris Chochiev.

News_Titles: Information of the press-bureau of the Foreign Ministry of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On November 18, 2011 in the Republic of South Ossetia took place a working meeting of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia Plenipotentiary Representative on post-conflict settlement B. Chochiev, Foreign Minister of the Republic of South Ossetia M. Dzhioev and Authorized of the President of the Republic of South Ossetia on Human Rights D. Sanakoev with Co-chairmen of Geneva Discussions on security in Transcaucasia.
At the meeting were discussed a number of urgent questions pertaining to the preparations to a regular round of Geneva Discussions in December of 2011.

News_Titles: Commentary of the press-bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning the Euro parliament resolution on Georgia
News_Shorts: On November 17, 2011 Euro parliament adopted a resolution on Georgia where it was stated that “the territories of Abkhazia and South Ossetia should be announced occupied territories” and also there contains an address to Russia “to fulfill committed in 2008 obligations and withdraw its troops from Georgian territories”.

News_Titles: Information of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On November 13, 2011 in the Republic of South Ossetia were held Presidential elections and a referendum on the status of Russian language.

News_Titles: Information of the press bureau of the Embassy of South Ossetia in Venezuela
News_Shorts: On November 7, 2001 took place a conversation of Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela Narim Kozaev and Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in the Republic of South Ossetia Ugo Hose Garsia Ernandes. In the beginning of conversation Mr. Narim Kozaev asked to pass the most sincere congratulations to madam Ivian Lunasol Sarcos Calmenares, who won the “Miss World” contest in London.

News_Titles: A commentary of the Foreign Ministry of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: In south Ossetia with interest following the course of talks between Russia and Georgia concerning Russian Federation’s joining to the World Trade Organization.

News_Titles: A commentary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning the speech of the President of France N. Sarkozy in Georgia
News_Shorts: On 7 of October 2011 during his visit to Georgia the President of France Nicolas Sarkozy gave raise to many questions by his speech at the meeting of many thousands in Tbilisi to those who concerned by the fortunes of peace and stability at the Caucasus indeed. Rather emotional speech of Sarkozy explicitly meant not only for Georgians but for French voters as well, dose not coincides with that President who in the August of 2008 really undertook significant mediatory efforts and together with the President of Russia D. A. Medvedev agreed Caucasus crisis management plan.

News_Titles: In Geneva ended 17th round of discussions
News_Shorts: In Geneva ended 17th round of discussions. As informed by phone from Geneva plenipotentiary representative of South Ossetia’s President on the questions of post-conflict settlement Boris Chochiev, first part of discussions was dedicated to discussion of situation in regions.

News_Titles: Information of the press-bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Today, on 20 of September 2011 in the Republic of South Ossetia are under way festive events dedicated to the 21 anniversary of creation of the Republic of South Ossetia. For the fourth time the people of South Ossetia celebrates this significant date of their history as a recognized state.

News_Titles: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Announcement about the Establishment of the Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of South Ossetia and Tuvalu
News_Shorts: On 19-20 September, 2011 Prime Minister of Tuvalu Willy Telavi visited the Republic of South Ossetia. During the visit on 19 September, 2011 Joint Statement on the Establishment of the Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of South Ossetia and Tuvalu was signed. On South Ossetia side the document was signed by the President of the Republic of South Ossetia Eduard Kokoity and on the side of Tuvalu by the Prime Minister of Tuvalu Willy Telavi.

News_Titles: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Press Service Announcement
News_Shorts:
Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua Narim Kozaev is paying an official visit to the Republic of Nicaragua.
On 5 September, the meeting of Ambassador and Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Nicaragua Samuel Santos Lopes was held. Narim Kozaev passed to Minister of Foreign Affairs copies of credential letters.

News_Titles: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Press Service Report
News_Shorts: On 7-8 August 2011, in all outward institutions of the MFA of South Ossetia the memorable activities dedicated to the third anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia were held.

News_Titles: Information of the press bureau of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the Republic of South Ossetia in Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela Narim Kozaev is presently on trip in Caracas. 
On 30 of August Narim Kozaev was received in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela. In course of the meeting an Ambassador handed the copies of credential letters to deputy Foregn Minister if Venezuela.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the third anniversary of recognition of Republic of South Ossetia by Russian Federation
News_Shorts: In the Republic of South Ossetia are under way festive events dedicated to the third anniversary of recognition of independence of the Republic of South Ossetia by Russian Federation. The date of August 26, 2008 was endorsed with golden letters in the historical chronicle of Ossetian people and celebrates as a state holiday – Day of recognition of State independence. This event became a greatest milestone in the modern history of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The Announcement the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the expected ‘peace march’
News_Shorts: For some past time we have received information that on 26 August, 2011 on the third anniversary of the Republic of South Ossetia recognition by the Russian Federation the official powers of Georgia intend to carry out a large-scale provocation on the border with South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The Announcement the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia in connection with the third anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia in August 2008
News_Shorts: On 7-8 August 2011, memorable events devoted to the third anniversary of the armed aggression of Georgia against South Ossetia are being held in the capital of the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia concerning the adopted by the US Senate resolution on Georgia.
News_Shorts: On July 29, 2011 US Senate adopted a resolution «Of Senate attitude to ongoing violations of territorial integrity and sovereignty of Georgia» that calls on necessary respect to the «territorial integrity and sovereignty of Georgia» and condemns Russia’s actions that ostensibly violates this integrity.

News_Titles: The Announcement the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts:
On 23 June 2011, General Agreement on Collaboration between the Republic of South Ossetia and Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela signed on 23 July 2010 in Caracas came into effect. Earlier both Parties implemented domestic procedures indispensable for the Agreement to be carried out concerning which the Ministries of Foreign Affairs of both countries had changed the notes. 
Tskhinval, 28 July 2011

News_Titles: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Announcement about the Establishment of the Republic of South Ossetia Embassy in the Republic of Nicaragua
News_Shorts: In connection with the establishment of the diplomatic relations between the Republic of South Ossetia and the Republic of Nicaragua as well as with the necessity of maintenance and development of the permanent links with the Republic of Nicaragua by the decree of the Republic of South Ossetia President E. Kokoity on 26 July 2011 the Embassy of the Republic of South Ossetia in the Republic of Nicaragua with the residence in city Tskhinval was established.

News_Titles: The Announcement the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia about the Delegation of the MFA of the Russian Federation Visit
News_Shorts: On 18-19 July a working visit of the delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation in the Republic of South Ossetia took place. The delegation composed of Deputy Director of CIS 4th Department MFA of the RF A.A. Dvinyatin and the RF Minister of Foreign Affairs Councilor M.M. Kulakhmetov.

News_Titles: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia Press Service Information
News_Shorts: On 19 July 2011, a regular meeting with the participation of Plenipotentiary Representative of President of the Republic of South Ossetia on Post-conflict settlement B.E. Chochiev, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia M.K. Jioev, State Counselor of President of RSO K.K. Kochiev with Co- Chairmen of the Geneva talks on security in the Transcaucasia was held in the Republic of South Ossetia. A range of questions related to the preparation to the 17 round of the Geneva talks in October 2011 was discussed at the meeting.

News_Titles: Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: According to information available in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia official Tbilisi plans to organize scaled provocations at the state border with the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The Report of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
News_Shorts: On 14 July 2011, the Day of a Peacekeeper is celebrated in the Republic of South Ossetia.

News_Titles: The answer of the Republic of South Ossetia Minister of Foreign Affairs Murat Kuzmich Jioev to the Question of South-Ossetia Information Agency ‘Res’
News_Shorts: Question. Joint NATO-Georgia conference is being held in Tbilisi. The main subject of the conference is joint plans of Georgia with North-Atlantic Alliance. In your opinion what such a close collaboration of NATO and Georgia can result in?

News_Titles: A statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs concerning the resolution adopted at the UN General Assembly
News_Shorts: On June 29, 2011 at the session of UN General Assembly in New York was adopted a resolution «Situation of displaced persons from Abkhazia, Georgia and Tskhinval Region/South Ossetia, Georgia».

News_Titles: Appeal of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia to members of UN GA in connection with proposed by Georgian delegation resolution project of 65 session of UN General Assembly on refugees and IDPs from Abkhazia and South Ossetia
News_Shorts: Georgian delegation has prepared and officially introduced to the secretariat resolution project of 65 session of the UN General Assembly “Situation of internally displaced persons from Abkhazia, Georgia and Tskhinvali region/South Ossetia, Georgia”. Text of the resolution project is similar to the previous year document. It is talked of refugees – ethnical Georgians, displaced in the consequence of attack of Georgian troops on South Ossetia in August 2008.

News_Titles: The Statement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of South Ossetia
